ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN

block.text: YOHANES

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN CHP 1
In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.

block.text: Pada mulanya adalah Firman; Firman itu bersama-sama dengan Allah dan Firman itu adalah Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The same was in the beginning with God.

block.text: Ia pada mulanya bersama-sama dengan Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All things were made through him. Without him was not anything made that has been made.

block.text: Segala sesuatu dijadikan oleh Dia dan tanpa Dia tidak ada suatupun yang telah jadi dari segala yang telah dijadikan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In him was life, and the life was the light of men.

block.text: Dalam Dia ada hidup dan hidup itu adalah terang manusia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness hasn't overcome it.

block.text: Terang itu bercahaya di dalam kegelapan dan kegelapan itu tidak menguasainya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There came a man, sent from God, whose name was John.

block.text: Datanglah seorang yang diutus Allah, namanya Yohanes;

ReferenceBlocks.text: The same came as a witness, that he might testify about the light, that all might believe through him.

block.text: ia datang sebagai saksi untuk memberi kesaksian tentang terang itu, supaya oleh dia semua orang menjadi percaya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was not the light, but was sent that he might testify about the light.

block.text: Ia bukan terang itu, tetapi ia harus memberi kesaksian tentang terang itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The true light that enlightens everyone was coming into the world.

block.text: Terang yang sesungguhnya, yang menerangi setiap orang, sedang datang ke dalam dunia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was in the world, and the world was made through him, and the world didn't recognize him.

block.text: Ia telah ada di dalam dunia dan dunia dijadikan oleh-Nya, tetapi dunia tidak mengenal-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came to his own, and those who were his own didn't receive him.

block.text: Ia datang kepada milik kepunyaan-Nya, tetapi orang-orang kepunyaan-Nya itu tidak menerima-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But as many as received him, to them he gave the right to become God's children, to those who believe in his name.

block.text: Tetapi semua orang yang menerima-Nya diberi-Nya kuasa supaya menjadi anak-anak Allah, yaitu mereka yang percaya dalam nama-Nya;

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were born not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.

block.text: orang-orang yang diperanakkan bukan dari darah atau dari daging, bukan pula secara jasmani oleh keinginan seorang laki-laki, melainkan dari Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Word became flesh, and lived among us. We saw his glory, such glory as of the only begotten Son of the Father, full of grace and truth.

block.text: Firman itu telah menjadi manusia, dan diam di antara kita, dan kita telah melihat kemuliaan-Nya, yaitu kemuliaan yang diberikan kepada-Nya sebagai Anak Tunggal Bapa, penuh kasih karunia dan kebenaran.

ReferenceBlocks.text: John testified about him. He cried out, saying,

block.text: Yohanes memberi kesaksian tentang Dia dan berseru, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This was he of whom I said, ‘He who comes after me has surpassed me, for he was before me.’”

block.text: <<Inilah Dia, yang kumaksudkan ketika aku berkata: <Kemudian dari padaku akan datang Dia yang telah mendahului aku, sebab Dia telah ada sebelum aku.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: From his fullness we all received grace upon grace.

block.text: Karena dari kepenuhan-Nya kita semua telah menerima kasih karunia demi kasih karunia;

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the law was given through Moses. Grace and truth were realized through Jesus Christ.

block.text: sebab hukum Taurat diberikan oleh Musa, tetapi kasih karunia dan kebenaran datang oleh Yesus Kristus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: No one has seen God at any time. The one and only Son, who is in the bosom of the Father, he has declared him.

block.text: Tidak seorangpun yang pernah melihat Allah; tetapi Anak Tunggal Allah, yang ada di pangkuan Bapa, Dialah yang menyatakan-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is John's testimony, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him,

block.text: Dan inilah kesaksian Yohanes ketika orang Yahudi dari Yerusalem mengutus beberapa imam dan orang-orang Lewi kepadanya untuk menanyakan dia:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who are you?”

block.text: <<Siapakah engkau?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He did not fail to declare, but declared freely,

block.text: Ia mengaku dan tidak berdusta, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am not the Christ.”

block.text: <<Aku bukan Mesias.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They asked him,

block.text: Lalu mereka bertanya kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What then? Are you Elijah?”

block.text: <<Kalau begitu, siapakah engkau? Elia?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Dan ia menjawab:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am not.”

block.text: <<Bukan!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They asked:

block.text: They asked,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you the prophet?”

block.text: <<Engkaukah nabi yang akan datang?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered,

block.text: Dan ia menjawab:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “No.”

block.text: <<Bukan!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said therefore to him,

block.text: Maka kata mereka kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who are you? Give us an answer to take back to those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?”

block.text: <<Siapakah engkau? Sebab kami harus memberi jawab kepada mereka yang mengutus kami. Apakah katamu tentang dirimu sendiri?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Jawabnya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness, ‘Make straight the way of the Lord,’ as Isaiah the prophet said.”

block.text: <<Akulah suara orang yang berseru-seru di padang gurun: Luruskanlah jalan Tuhan! seperti yang telah dikatakan nabi Yesaya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The ones who had been sent were from the Pharisees.
They asked him,

block.text: Dan di antara orang-orang yang diutus itu ada beberapa orang Farisi.
Mereka bertanya kepadanya, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why then do you baptize, if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the prophet?”

block.text: <<Mengapakah engkau membaptis, jikalau engkau bukan Mesias, bukan Elia, dan bukan nabi yang akan datang?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: John answered them,

block.text: Yohanes menjawab mereka, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I baptize in water, but among you stands one whom you don't know.

block.text: <<Aku membaptis dengan air; tetapi di tengah-tengah kamu berdiri Dia yang tidak kamu kenal,

ReferenceBlocks.text: He is the one who comes after me, who is preferred before me, whose sandal strap I'm not worthy to loosen.”

block.text: yaitu Dia, yang datang kemudian dari padaku. Membuka tali kasut-Nyapun aku tidak layak.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: These things were done in Bethany beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.

block.text: Hal itu terjadi di Betania yang di seberang sungai Yordan, di mana Yohanes membaptis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The next day, he saw Jesus coming to him, and said,

block.text: Pada keesokan harinya Yohanes melihat Yesus datang kepadanya dan ia berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world!

block.text: <<Lihatlah Anak domba Allah, yang menghapus dosa dunia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is he of whom I said, ‘After me comes a man who is preferred before me, for he was before me.’

block.text: Dialah yang kumaksud ketika kukatakan: <Kemudian dari padaku akan datang seorang, yang telah mendahului aku, sebab Dia telah ada sebelum aku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I didn't know him, but for this reason I came baptizing in water: that he would be revealed to Israel.”

block.text: Dan aku sendiripun mula-mula tidak mengenal Dia, tetapi untuk itulah aku datang dan membaptis dengan air, supaya Ia dinyatakan kepada Israel.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: John testified, saying,

block.text: Dan Yohanes memberi kesaksian, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have seen the Spirit descending like a dove out of heaven, and it remained on him.

block.text: <<Aku telah melihat Roh turun dari langit seperti merpati, dan Ia tinggal di atas-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I didn't recognize him, but he who sent me to baptize in water, he said to me, ‘On whomever you will see the Spirit descending, and remaining on him, the same is he who baptizes in the Holy Spirit.’

block.text: Dan akupun tidak mengenal-Nya, tetapi Dia, yang mengutus aku untuk membaptis dengan air, telah berfirman kepadaku: <Jikalau engkau melihat Roh itu turun ke atas seseorang dan tinggal di atas-Nya, Dialah itu yang akan membaptis dengan Roh Kudus.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: I have seen, and have testified that this is the Son of God.”

block.text: Jawab Yohanes, Dan aku telah melihat-Nya dan memberi kesaksian: Ia inilah Anak Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again, the next day, John was standing with two of his disciples.

block.text: Pada keesokan harinya Yohanes berdiri di situ pula dengan dua orang muridnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He looked at Jesus as he walked, and said,

block.text: Dan ketika ia melihat Yesus lewat, ia berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, the Lamb of God!”

block.text: <<Lihatlah Anak domba Allah!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the two disciples heard him speak they followed Jesus.

block.text: Kedua murid itu mendengar apa yang dikatakannya itu, lalu mereka pergi mengikut Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus turned, and saw them following, and said to them,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus menoleh ke belakang. Ia melihat, bahwa mereka mengikut Dia lalu berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What are you looking for?”

block.text: <<Apakah yang kamu cari?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Kata mereka kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi”

block.text: <<Rabi>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: (which is to say, being interpreted, Teacher),

block.text: (artinya: Guru),

ReferenceBlocks.text: “where are you staying?”

block.text: <<di manakah Engkau tinggal?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come, and see.”

block.text: <<Marilah dan kamu akan melihatnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came and saw where he was staying, and they stayed with him that day. It was about the tenth hour.

block.text: Merekapun datang dan melihat di mana Ia tinggal, dan hari itu mereka tinggal bersama-sama dengan Dia; waktu itu kira-kira pukul empat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of the two who heard John, and followed him, was Andrew, Simon Peter's brother.

block.text: Salah seorang dari keduanya yang mendengar perkataan Yohanes lalu mengikut Yesus adalah Andreas, saudara Simon Petrus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He first found his own brother, Simon, and said to him,

block.text: Andreas mula-mula bertemu dengan Simon, saudaranya, dan ia berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We have found the Messiah!”

block.text: <<Kami telah menemukan Mesias>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: (which means, Christ).
He brought him to Jesus. Jesus looked at him, and said,

block.text: (artinya: Kristus).
Ia membawanya kepada Yesus. Yesus memandang dia dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are Simon the son of Jonah. You shall be called Cephas.”

block.text: <<Engkau Simon, anak Yohanes, engkau akan dinamakan Kefas>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: (which is by interpretation, Peter).

block.text: (artinya: Petrus).

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the next day, he was determined to go out into Galilee, and he found Philip. Jesus said to him,

block.text: Pada keesokan harinya Yesus memutuskan untuk berangkat ke Galilea. Ia bertemu dengan Filipus, dan berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Follow me.”

block.text: <<Ikutlah Aku!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Philip was from Bethsaida, of the city of Andrew and Peter.

block.text: Filipus itu berasal dari Betsaida, kota Andreas dan Petrus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Philip found Nathanael, and said to him,

block.text: Filipus bertemu dengan Natanael dan berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We have found him, of whom Moses in the law, and the prophets, wrote: Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.”

block.text: <<Kami telah menemukan Dia, yang disebut oleh Musa dalam kitab Taurat dan oleh para nabi, yaitu Yesus, anak Yusuf dari Nazaret.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nathanael said to him,

block.text: Kata Natanael kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Can any good thing come out of Nazareth?”

block.text: <<Mungkinkah sesuatu yang baik datang dari Nazaret?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Philip said to him,

block.text: Kata Filipus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come and see.”

block.text: <<Mari dan lihatlah!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him, and said about him,

block.text: Yesus melihat Natanael datang kepada-Nya, lalu berkata tentang dia:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, an Israelite indeed, in whom is no deceit!”

block.text: <<Lihat, inilah seorang Israel sejati, tidak ada kepalsuan di dalamnya!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nathanael said to him,

block.text: Kata Natanael kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How do you know me?”

block.text: <<Bagaimana Engkau mengenal aku?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered him,

block.text: Jawab Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”

block.text: <<Sebelum Filipus memanggil engkau, Aku telah melihat engkau di bawah pohon ara.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nathanael answered him,

block.text: Kata Natanael kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi, you are the Son of God! You are King of Israel!”

block.text: <<Rabi, Engkau Anak Allah, Engkau Raja orang Israel!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered him,

block.text: Yesus menjawab, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Because I told you, ‘I saw you underneath the fig tree,’ do you believe? You will see greater things than these!”

block.text: <<Karena Aku berkata kepadamu: Aku melihat engkau di bawah pohon ara, maka engkau percaya? Engkau akan melihat hal-hal yang lebih besar dari pada itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Lalu kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly, I tell you, hereafter you will see heaven opened, and the angels of God ascending and descending on the Son of Man.”

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya engkau akan melihat langit terbuka dan malaikat-malaikat Allah turun naik kepada Anak Manusia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN CHP 2
The third day, there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee. Jesus’ mother was there.

block.text: Pada hari ketiga ada perkawinan di Kana yang di Galilea, dan ibu Yesus ada di situ;

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus also was invited, with his disciples, to the marriage.

block.text: Yesus dan murid-murid-Nya diundang juga ke perkawinan itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the wine ran out, Jesus’ mother said to him,

block.text: Ketika mereka kekurangan anggur, ibu Yesus berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They have no wine.”

block.text: <<Mereka kehabisan anggur.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to her,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Dear woman, what does that have to do with you and me? My hour has not yet come.”

block.text: <<Mau apakah engkau dari pada-Ku, ibu? Saat-Ku belum tiba.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: His mother said to the servants,

block.text: Tetapi ibu Yesus berkata kepada pelayan-pelayan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whatever he says to you, do it.”

block.text: <<Apa yang dikatakan kepadamu, buatlah itu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now there were six water pots of stone set there after the Jews’ way of purifying, containing two or three metretes apiece.
Jesus said to them,

block.text: Di situ ada enam tempayan yang disediakan untuk pembasuhan menurut adat orang Yahudi, masing-masing isinya dua tiga buyung.
Yesus berkata kepada pelayan-pelayan itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Fill the water pots with water.”

block.text: <<Isilah tempayan-tempayan itu penuh dengan air.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They filled them up to the brim.
He said to them,

block.text: Dan merekapun mengisinya sampai penuh.
Lalu kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now draw some out, and take it to the ruler of the feast.”

block.text: <<Sekarang cedoklah dan bawalah kepada pemimpin pesta.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So they took it.
When the ruler of the feast tasted the water now become wine, and didn't know where it came from (but the servants who had drawn the water knew), the ruler of the feast called the bridegroom,
and said to him,

block.text: Lalu merekapun membawanya.

Setelah pemimpin pesta itu mengecap air, yang telah menjadi anggur itu—dan ia tidak tahu dari mana datangnya, tetapi pelayan-pelayan, yang mencedok air itu, mengetahuinya—ia memanggil mempelai laki-laki,
dan berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Everyone serves the good wine first, and when the guests have drunk freely, then that which is worse. You have kept the good wine until now!”

block.text: <<Setiap orang menghidangkan anggur yang baik dahulu dan sesudah orang puas minum, barulah yang kurang baik; akan tetapi engkau menyimpan anggur yang baik sampai sekarang.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: This beginning of his signs Jesus did in Cana of Galilee, and revealed his glory; and his disciples believed in him.

block.text: Hal itu dibuat Yesus di Kana yang di Galilea, sebagai yang pertama dari tanda-tanda-Nya dan dengan itu Ia telah menyatakan kemuliaan-Nya, dan murid-murid-Nya percaya kepada-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After this, he went down to Capernaum, he, and his mother, his brothers, and his disciples; and they stayed there a few days.

block.text: Sesudah itu Yesus pergi ke Kapernaum, bersama-sama dengan ibu-Nya dan saudara-saudara-Nya dan murid-murid-Nya, dan mereka tinggal di situ hanya beberapa hari saja.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Passover of the Jews was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

block.text: Ketika hari raya Paskah orang Yahudi sudah dekat, Yesus berangkat ke Yerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He found in the temple those who sold oxen, sheep, and doves, and the changers of money sitting.

block.text: Dalam Bait Suci didapati-Nya pedagang-pedagang lembu, kambing domba dan merpati, dan penukar-penukar uang duduk di situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He made a whip of cords, and threw all out of the temple, both the sheep and the oxen; and he poured out the changers’ money, and overthrew their tables.
To those who sold the doves, he said,

block.text: Ia membuat cambuk dari tali lalu mengusir mereka semua dari Bait Suci dengan semua kambing domba dan lembu mereka; uang penukar-penukar dihamburkan-Nya ke tanah dan meja-meja mereka dibalikkan-Nya.
Kepada pedagang-pedagang merpati Ia berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Take these things out of here! Don't make my Father's house a marketplace!”

block.text: <<Ambil semuanya ini dari sini, jangan kamu membuat rumah Bapa-Ku menjadi tempat berjualan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: His disciples remembered that it was written,

block.text: Maka teringatlah murid-murid-Nya, bahwa ada tertulis:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Zeal for your house will eat me up.”

block.text: <<Cinta untuk rumah-Mu menghanguskan Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Jews therefore answered him,

block.text: Orang-orang Yahudi menantang Yesus, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What sign do you show us, seeing that you do these things?”

block.text: <<Tanda apakah dapat Engkau tunjukkan kepada kami, bahwa Engkau berhak bertindak demikian?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.”

block.text: <<Rombak Bait Allah ini, dan dalam tiga hari Aku akan mendirikannya kembali.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Jews therefore said,

block.text: Lalu kata orang Yahudi kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It took forty-six years to build this temple! Will you raise it up in three days?”

block.text: <<Empat puluh enam tahun orang mendirikan Bait Allah ini dan Engkau dapat membangunnya dalam tiga hari?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he spoke of the temple of his body.

block.text: Tetapi yang dimaksudkan-Nya dengan Bait Allah ialah tubuh-Nya sendiri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When therefore he was raised from the dead, his disciples remembered that he said this, and they believed the Scripture, and the word which Jesus had said.

block.text: Kemudian, sesudah Ia bangkit dari antara orang mati, barulah teringat oleh murid-murid-Nya bahwa hal itu telah dikatakan-Nya, dan merekapun percayalah akan Kitab Suci dan akan perkataan yang telah diucapkan Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when he was in Jerusalem at the Passover, during the feast, many believed in his name, observing his signs which he did.

block.text: Dan sementara Ia di Yerusalem selama hari raya Paskah, banyak orang percaya dalam nama-Nya, karena mereka telah melihat tanda-tanda yang diadakan-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus didn't trust himself to them, because he knew everyone,
and because he didn't need for anyone to testify concerning man; for he himself knew what was in man.

block.text: Tetapi Yesus sendiri tidak mempercayakan diri-Nya kepada mereka, karena Ia mengenal mereka semua,
dan karena tidak perlu seorangpun memberi kesaksian kepada-Nya tentang manusia, sebab Ia tahu apa yang ada di dalam hati manusia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN CHP 3
Now there was a man of the Pharisees named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews.

block.text: Adalah seorang Farisi yang bernama Nikodemus, seorang pemimpin agama Yahudi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The same came to him by night, and said to him,

block.text: Ia datang pada waktu malam kepada Yesus dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi, we know that you are a teacher come from God, for no one can do these signs that you do, unless God is with him.”

block.text: <<Rabi, kami tahu, bahwa Engkau datang sebagai guru yang diutus Allah; sebab tidak ada seorangpun yang dapat mengadakan tanda-tanda yang Engkau adakan itu, jika Allah tidak menyertainya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered him,

block.text: Yesus menjawab, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly, I tell you, unless one is born anew, he can't see the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya jika seorang tidak dilahirkan kembali, ia tidak dapat melihat Kerajaan Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nicodemus said to him,

block.text: Kata Nikodemus kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How can a man be born when he is old? Can he enter a second time into his mother's womb, and be born?”

block.text: <<Bagaimanakah mungkin seorang dilahirkan, kalau ia sudah tua? Dapatkah ia masuk kembali ke dalam rahim ibunya dan dilahirkan lagi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, unless one is born of water and spirit, he can't enter into the Kingdom of God!

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya jika seorang tidak dilahirkan dari air dan Roh, ia tidak dapat masuk ke dalam Kerajaan Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: That which is born of the flesh is flesh. That which is born of the Spirit is spirit.

block.text: Apa yang dilahirkan dari daging, adalah daging, dan apa yang dilahirkan dari Roh, adalah roh.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don't marvel that I said to you, ‘You must be born anew.’

block.text: Janganlah engkau heran, karena Aku berkata kepadamu: <Kamu harus dilahirkan kembali.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The wind blows where it wants to, and you hear its sound, but don't know where it comes from and where it is going. So is everyone who is born of the Spirit.”

block.text: Angin bertiup ke mana ia mau, dan engkau mendengar bunyinya, tetapi engkau tidak tahu dari mana ia datang atau ke mana ia pergi. Demikianlah halnya dengan tiap-tiap orang yang lahir dari Roh.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nicodemus answered him,

block.text: Nikodemus menjawab, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How can these things be?”

block.text: <<Bagaimanakah mungkin hal itu terjadi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered him,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you the teacher of Israel, and don't understand these things?

block.text: <<Engkau adalah pengajar Israel, dan engkau tidak mengerti hal-hal itu?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, we speak that which we know, and testify of that which we have seen, and you don't receive our witness.

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya kami berkata-kata tentang apa yang kami ketahui dan kami bersaksi tentang apa yang kami lihat, tetapi kamu tidak menerima kesaksian kami.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If I told you earthly things and you don't believe, how will you believe if I tell you heavenly things?

block.text: Kamu tidak percaya, waktu Aku berkata-kata dengan kamu tentang hal-hal duniawi, bagaimana kamu akan percaya, kalau Aku berkata-kata dengan kamu tentang hal-hal sorgawi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: No one has ascended into heaven, but he who descended out of heaven, the Son of Man, who is in heaven.

block.text: Tidak ada seorangpun yang telah naik ke sorga, selain dari pada Dia yang telah turun dari sorga, yaitu Anak Manusia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of Man be lifted up,
that whoever believes in him should not perish, but have eternal life.

block.text: Dan sama seperti Musa meninggikan ular di padang gurun, demikian juga Anak Manusia harus ditinggikan,
supaya setiap orang yang percaya kepada-Nya beroleh hidup yang kekal.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish, but have eternal life.

block.text: <<Karena begitu besar kasih Allah akan dunia ini, sehingga Ia telah mengaruniakan Anak-Nya yang tunggal, supaya setiap orang yang percaya kepada-Nya tidak binasa, melainkan beroleh hidup yang kekal.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For God didn't send his Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world should be saved through him.

block.text: Sebab Allah mengutus Anak-Nya ke dalam dunia bukan untuk menghakimi dunia, melainkan untuk menyelamatkannya oleh Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who believes in him is not judged. He who doesn't believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God.

block.text: Barangsiapa percaya kepada-Nya, ia tidak akan dihukum; barangsiapa tidak percaya, ia telah berada di bawah hukuman, sebab ia tidak percaya dalam nama Anak Tunggal Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is the judgment, that the light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the light; for their works were evil.

block.text: <<Dan inilah hukuman itu: Terang telah datang ke dalam dunia, tetapi manusia lebih menyukai kegelapan dari pada terang, sebab perbuatan-perbuatan mereka jahat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For everyone who does evil hates the light, and doesn't come to the light, lest his works would be exposed.

block.text: Sebab barangsiapa berbuat jahat, membenci terang dan tidak datang kepada terang itu, supaya perbuatan-perbuatannya yang jahat itu tidak nampak;

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he who does the truth comes to the light, that his works may be revealed, that they have been done in God.”

block.text: tetapi barangsiapa melakukan yang benar, ia datang kepada terang, supaya menjadi nyata, bahwa perbuatan-perbuatannya dilakukan dalam Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: After these things, Jesus came with his disciples into the land of Judea. He stayed there with them, and baptized.

block.text: Sesudah itu Yesus pergi dengan murid-murid-Nya ke tanah Yudea dan Ia diam di sana bersama-sama mereka dan membaptis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: John also was baptizing in Enon near Salim, because there was much water there. They came, and were baptized.

block.text: Akan tetapi Yohanespun membaptis juga di Ainon, dekat Salim, sebab di situ banyak air, dan orang-orang datang ke situ untuk dibaptis,

ReferenceBlocks.text: For John was not yet thrown into prison.

block.text: sebab pada waktu itu Yohanes belum dimasukkan ke dalam penjara.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There arose therefore a questioning on the part of John's disciples with some Jews about purification.

block.text: Maka timbullah perselisihan di antara murid-murid Yohanes dengan seorang Yahudi tentang penyucian.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came to John, and said to him,

block.text: Lalu mereka datang kepada Yohanes dan berkata kepadanya:

block.characterId: disciples of John the Baptist/a Jew

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: disciples of John the Baptist/a Jew
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi, he who was with you beyond the Jordan, to whom you have testified, behold, the same baptizes, and everyone is coming to him.”

block.text: <<Rabi, orang yang bersama dengan engkau di seberang sungai Yordan dan yang tentang Dia engkau telah memberi kesaksian, Dia membaptis juga dan semua orang pergi kepada-Nya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: John answered,

block.text: Jawab Yohanes:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A man can receive nothing, unless it has been given him from heaven.

block.text: <<Tidak ada seorangpun yang dapat mengambil sesuatu bagi dirinya, kalau tidak dikaruniakan kepadanya dari sorga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You yourselves testify that I said, ‘I am not the Christ,’ but, ‘I have been sent before him.’

block.text: Kamu sendiri dapat memberi kesaksian, bahwa aku telah berkata: <Aku bukan Mesias, tetapi aku diutus untuk mendahului-Nya.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who has the bride is the bridegroom; but the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and hears him, rejoices greatly because of the bridegroom's voice. This, my joy, therefore is made full.

block.text: Yang empunya mempelai perempuan, ialah mempelai laki-laki; tetapi sahabat mempelai laki-laki, yang berdiri dekat dia dan yang mendengarkannya, sangat bersukacita mendengar suara mempelai laki-laki itu. Itulah sukacitaku, dan sekarang sukacitaku itu penuh.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He must increase, but I must decrease.

block.text: Ia harus makin besar, tetapi aku harus makin kecil.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who comes from above is above all. He who is from the earth belongs to the earth, and speaks of the earth. He who comes from heaven is above all.

block.text: <<Siapa yang datang dari atas adalah di atas semuanya; siapa yang berasal dari bumi, termasuk pada bumi dan berkata-kata dalam bahasa bumi. Siapa yang datang dari sorga adalah di atas semuanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What he has seen and heard, of that he testifies; and no one receives his witness.

block.text: Ia memberi kesaksian tentang apa yang dilihat-Nya dan yang didengar-Nya, tetapi tak seorangpun yang menerima kesaksian-Nya itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who has received his witness has set his seal to this, that God is true.

block.text: Siapa yang menerima kesaksian-Nya itu, ia mengaku, bahwa Allah adalah benar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he whom God has sent speaks the words of God; for God gives the Spirit without measure.

block.text: Sebab siapa yang diutus Allah, Dialah yang menyampaikan firman Allah, karena Allah mengaruniakan Roh-Nya dengan tidak terbatas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Father loves the Son, and has given all things into his hand.

block.text: Bapa mengasihi Anak dan telah menyerahkan segala sesuatu kepada-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: One who believes in the Son has eternal life, but one who disobeys the Son won't see life, but the wrath of God remains on him.”

block.text: Barangsiapa percaya kepada Anak, ia beroleh hidup yang kekal, tetapi barangsiapa tidak taat kepada Anak, ia tidak akan melihat hidup, melainkan murka Allah tetap ada di atasnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN CHP 4
Therefore when the Lord knew that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus was making and baptizing more disciples than John
(although Jesus himself didn't baptize, but his disciples),
he left Judea, and departed into Galilee.

block.text: Ketika Tuhan Yesus mengetahui, bahwa orang-orang Farisi telah mendengar, bahwa Ia memperoleh dan membaptis murid lebih banyak dari pada Yohanes
—meskipun Yesus sendiri tidak membaptis, melainkan murid-murid-Nya, —
Iapun meninggalkan Yudea dan kembali lagi ke Galilea.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He needed to pass through Samaria.

block.text: Ia harus melintasi daerah Samaria.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So he came to a city of Samaria, called Sychar, near the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son, Joseph.

block.text: Maka sampailah Ia ke sebuah kota di Samaria, yang bernama Sikhar dekat tanah yang diberikan Yakub dahulu kepada anaknya, Yusuf.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jacob's well was there. Jesus therefore, being tired from his journey, sat down by the well. It was about the sixth hour.

block.text: Di situ terdapat sumur Yakub. Yesus sangat letih oleh perjalanan, karena itu Ia duduk di pinggir sumur itu. Hari kira-kira pukul dua belas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A woman of Samaria came to draw water. Jesus said to her,

block.text: Maka datanglah seorang perempuan Samaria hendak menimba air. Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Give me a drink.”

block.text: <<Berilah Aku minum.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For his disciples had gone away into the city to buy food.

block.text: Sebab murid-murid-Nya telah pergi ke kota untuk membeli makanan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Samaritan woman therefore said to him,

block.text: Maka kata perempuan Samaria itu kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How is it that you, being a Jew, ask for a drink from me, a Samaritan woman?”

block.text: <<Masakan Engkau, seorang Yahudi, minta minum kepadaku, seorang Samaria?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: (For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.)
Jesus answered her,

block.text: (Sebab orang Yahudi tidak bergaul dengan orang Samaria.)
Jawab Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you knew the gift of God, and who it is who says to you, ‘Give me a drink,’ you would have asked him, and he would have given you living water.”

block.text: <<Jikalau engkau tahu tentang karunia Allah dan siapakah Dia yang berkata kepadamu: Berilah Aku minum! niscaya engkau telah meminta kepada-Nya dan Ia telah memberikan kepadamu air hidup.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The woman said to him,

block.text: Kata perempuan itu kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sir, you have nothing to draw with, and the well is deep. From where then have you that living water?

block.text: <<Tuhan, Engkau tidak punya timba dan sumur ini amat dalam; dari manakah Engkau memperoleh air hidup itu?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Are you greater than our father, Jacob, who gave us the well, and drank of it himself, as did his children, and his livestock?”

block.text: Adakah Engkau lebih besar dari pada bapa kami Yakub, yang memberikan sumur ini kepada kami dan yang telah minum sendiri dari dalamnya, ia serta anak-anaknya dan ternaknya?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered her,

block.text: Jawab Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Everyone who drinks of this water will thirst again,

block.text: <<Barangsiapa minum air ini, ia akan haus lagi,

ReferenceBlocks.text: but whoever drinks of the water that I will give him will never thirst again; but the water that I will give him will become in him a well of water springing up to eternal life.”

block.text: tetapi barangsiapa minum air yang akan Kuberikan kepadanya, ia tidak akan haus untuk selama-lamanya. Sebaliknya air yang akan Kuberikan kepadanya, akan menjadi mata air di dalam dirinya, yang terus-menerus memancar sampai kepada hidup yang kekal.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The woman said to him,

block.text: Kata perempuan itu kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sir, give me this water, so that I don't get thirsty, neither come all the way here to draw.”

block.text: <<Tuhan, berikanlah aku air itu, supaya aku tidak haus dan tidak usah datang lagi ke sini untuk menimba air.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to her,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go, call your husband, and come here.”

block.text: <<Pergilah, panggillah suamimu dan datang ke sini.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The woman answered,

block.text: Kata perempuan itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have no husband.”

block.text: <<Aku tidak mempunyai suami.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to her,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You said well, ‘I have no husband,’
for you have had five husbands; and he whom you now have is not your husband. This you have said truly.”

block.text: <<Tepat katamu, bahwa engkau tidak mempunyai suami,
sebab engkau sudah mempunyai lima suami dan yang ada sekarang padamu, bukanlah suamimu. Dalam hal ini engkau berkata benar.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The woman said to him,

block.text: Kata perempuan itu kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sir, I perceive that you are a prophet.

block.text: <<Tuhan, nyata sekarang padaku, bahwa Engkau seorang nabi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Our fathers worshiped in this mountain, but you Jews say that in Jerusalem is the place where people ought to worship.”

block.text: Nenek moyang kami menyembah di atas gunung ini, tetapi kamu katakan, bahwa Yerusalemlah tempat orang menyembah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to her,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woman, believe me, the hour comes, when neither in this mountain, nor in Jerusalem, will you worship the Father.

block.text: <<Percayalah kepada-Ku, hai perempuan, saatnya akan tiba, bahwa kamu akan menyembah Bapa bukan di gunung ini dan bukan juga di Yerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You worship that which you don't know. We worship that which we know; for salvation is from the Jews.

block.text: Kamu menyembah apa yang tidak kamu kenal, kami menyembah apa yang kami kenal, sebab keselamatan datang dari bangsa Yahudi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the hour comes, and now is, when the true worshippers will worship the Father in spirit and truth, for the Father seeks such to be his worshippers.

block.text: Tetapi saatnya akan datang dan sudah tiba sekarang, bahwa penyembah-penyembah benar akan menyembah Bapa dalam roh dan kebenaran; sebab Bapa menghendaki penyembah-penyembah demikian.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God is a Spirit, and those who worship him must worship in spirit and truth.”

block.text: Allah itu Roh dan barangsiapa menyembah Dia, harus menyembah-Nya dalam roh dan kebenaran.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The woman said to him,

block.text: Jawab perempuan itu kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I know that Messiah comes,” (he who is called Christ). “When he has come, he will declare to us all things.”

block.text: <<Aku tahu, bahwa Mesias akan datang, yang disebut juga Kristus; apabila Ia datang, Ia akan memberitakan segala sesuatu kepada kami.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to her,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am he, the one who speaks to you.”

block.text: <<Akulah Dia, yang sedang berkata-kata dengan engkau.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: At this, his disciples came. They marveled that he was speaking with a woman; yet no one said, “What are you looking for?” or, “Why do you speak with her?”

block.text: Pada waktu itu datanglah murid-murid-Nya dan mereka heran, bahwa Ia sedang bercakap-cakap dengan seorang perempuan. Tetapi tidak seorangpun yang berkata: <<Apa yang Engkau kehendaki?>> Atau: <<Apa yang Engkau percakapkan dengan dia?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So the woman left her water pot, and went away into the city, and said to the people,

block.text: Maka perempuan itu meninggalkan tempayannya di situ lalu pergi ke kota dan berkata kepada orang-orang yang di situ:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come, see a man who told me everything that I did. Can this be the Christ?”

block.text: <<Mari, lihat! Di sana ada seorang yang mengatakan kepadaku segala sesuatu yang telah kuperbuat. Mungkinkah Dia Kristus itu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went out of the city, and were coming to him.

block.text: Maka merekapun pergi ke luar kota lalu datang kepada Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the meanwhile, the disciples urged him, saying,

block.text: Sementara itu murid-murid-Nya mengajak Dia, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi, eat.”

block.text: <<Rabi, makanlah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said to them,

block.text: Akan tetapi Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have food to eat that you don't know about.”

block.text: <<Pada-Ku ada makanan yang tidak kamu kenal.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciples therefore said one to another,

block.text: Maka murid-murid itu berkata seorang kepada yang lain:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Has anyone brought him something to eat?”

block.text: <<Adakah orang yang telah membawa sesuatu kepada-Nya untuk dimakan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My food is to do the will of him who sent me, and to accomplish his work.

block.text: <<Makanan-Ku ialah melakukan kehendak Dia yang mengutus Aku dan menyelesaikan pekerjaan-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don't you say, ‘There are yet four months until the harvest?’ Behold, I tell you, lift up your eyes, and look at the fields, that they are white for harvest already.

block.text: Bukankah kamu mengatakan: <Empat bulan lagi tibalah musim menuai?> Tetapi Aku berkata kepadamu: Lihatlah sekelilingmu dan pandanglah ladang-ladang yang sudah menguning dan matang untuk dituai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who reaps receives wages, and gathers fruit to eternal life; that both he who sows and he who reaps may rejoice together.

block.text: Sekarang juga penuai telah menerima upahnya dan ia mengumpulkan buah untuk hidup yang kekal, sehingga penabur dan penuai sama-sama bersukacita.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For in this the saying is true, ‘One sows, and another reaps.’

block.text: Sebab dalam hal ini benarlah peribahasa: Yang seorang menabur dan yang lain menuai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I sent you to reap that for which you haven't labored. Others have labored, and you have entered into their labor.”

block.text: Aku mengutus kamu untuk menuai apa yang tidak kamu usahakan; orang-orang lain berusaha dan kamu datang memetik hasil usaha mereka.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: From that city many of the Samaritans believed in him because of the word of the woman, who testified, “He told me everything that I did.”

block.text: Dan banyak orang Samaria dari kota itu telah menjadi percaya kepada-Nya karena perkataan perempuan itu, yang bersaksi: <<Ia mengatakan kepadaku segala sesuatu yang telah kuperbuat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when the Samaritans came to him, they begged him to stay with them. He stayed there two days.

block.text: Ketika orang-orang Samaria itu sampai kepada Yesus, mereka meminta kepada-Nya, supaya Ia tinggal pada mereka; dan Iapun tinggal di situ dua hari lamanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many more believed because of his word.

block.text: Dan lebih banyak lagi orang yang menjadi percaya karena perkataan-Nya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to the woman,

block.text: dan mereka berkata kepada perempuan itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now we believe, not because of your speaking; for we have heard for ourselves, and know that this is indeed the Christ, the Savior of the world.”

block.text: <<Kami percaya, tetapi bukan lagi karena apa yang kaukatakan, sebab kami sendiri telah mendengar Dia dan kami tahu, bahwa Dialah benar-benar Juruselamat dunia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: After the two days he went out from there and went into Galilee.

block.text: Dan setelah dua hari itu Yesus berangkat dari sana ke Galilea,

ReferenceBlocks.text: For Jesus himself testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country.

block.text: sebab Yesus sendiri telah bersaksi, bahwa seorang nabi tidak dihormati di negerinya sendiri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when he came into Galilee, the Galileans received him, having seen all the things that he did in Jerusalem at the feast, for they also went to the feast.

block.text: Maka setelah ia tiba di Galilea, orang-orang Galileapun menyambut Dia, karena mereka telah melihat segala sesuatu yang dikerjakan-Nya di Yerusalem pada pesta itu, sebab mereka sendiripun turut ke pesta itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus came therefore again to Cana of Galilee, where he made the water into wine. There was a certain nobleman whose son was sick at Capernaum.

block.text: Maka Yesus kembali lagi ke Kana di Galilea, di mana Ia membuat air menjadi anggur. Dan di Kapernaum ada seorang pegawai istana, anaknya sedang sakit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he heard that Jesus had left Judea and had come to Galilee, he went to him, and begged him, saying:

block.text: Ketika ia mendengar, bahwa Yesus telah datang dari Yudea ke Galilea, pergilah ia kepada-Nya lalu meminta,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come and heal my son because he is at the point of death.”

block.text: supaya Ia datang dan menyembuhkan anaknya, sebab anaknya itu hampir mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus therefore said to him,

block.text: Maka kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Unless you see signs and wonders, you will in no way believe.”

block.text: <<Jika kamu tidak melihat tanda dan mujizat, kamu tidak percaya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The nobleman said to him,

block.text: Pegawai istana itu berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sir, come down before my child dies.”

block.text: <<Tuhan, datanglah sebelum anakku mati.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go your way. Your son lives.”

block.text: <<Pergilah, anakmu hidup!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him, and he went his way.

block.text: Orang itu percaya akan perkataan yang dikatakan Yesus kepadanya, lalu pergi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he was now going down, his servants met him and reported, saying

block.text: Ketika ia masih di tengah jalan hamba-hambanya telah datang kepadanya dengan kabar,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your child lives!”

block.text: bahwa anaknya hidup.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So he asked them:

block.text: Ia bertanya

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What time did he get better?”

block.text: kepada mereka pukul berapa anak itu mulai sembuh.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him:

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The fever left him yesterday, at the seventh hour.”

block.text: <<Kemarin siang pukul satu demamnya hilang.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So the father knew that it was at that hour in which Jesus said to him, “Your son lives.” He believed, as did his whole house.

block.text: Maka teringatlah ayah itu, bahwa pada saat itulah Yesus berkata kepadanya: <<Anakmu hidup.>> Lalu iapun percaya, ia dan seluruh keluarganya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is again the second sign that Jesus did, having come out of Judea into Galilee.

block.text: Dan itulah tanda kedua yang dibuat Yesus ketika Ia pulang dari Yudea ke Galilea.

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN CHP 5
After these things, there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

block.text: Sesudah itu ada hari raya orang Yahudi, dan Yesus berangkat ke Yerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now in Jerusalem by the sheep gate, there is a pool, which is called in Hebrew, “Bethesda,” having five porches.

block.text: Sekarang di Yerusalem oleh gerbang domba, ada kolam, yang disebut dalam bahasa Ibrani, "Bethesda," memiliki lima serambi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In these lay a great multitude of those who were sick, blind, lame, or paralyzed, waiting for the moving of the water;

block.text: Dalam berbaring sejumlah besar orang-orang sakit, buta, lumpuh, atau lumpuh, menunggu air untuk bergerak;

ReferenceBlocks.text: for an angel went down at certain times into the pool, and stirred up the water. Whoever stepped in first after the stirring of the water was made whole of whatever disease he had.

block.text: Sebab sewaktu-waktu turun malaikat Tuhan ke kolam itu dan menggoncangkan air itu; barangsiapa yang terdahulu masuk ke dalamnya sesudah goncangan air itu, menjadi sembuh, apapun juga penyakitnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain man was there, who had been sick for thirty-eight years.

block.text: Di situ ada seorang yang sudah tiga puluh delapan tahun lamanya sakit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus saw him lying there, and knew that he had been sick for a long time, he asked him,

block.text: Ketika Yesus melihat orang itu berbaring di situ dan karena Ia tahu, bahwa ia telah lama dalam keadaan itu, berkatalah Ia kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you want to be made well?”

block.text: <<Maukah engkau sembuh?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The sick man answered him,

block.text: Jawab orang sakit itu kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sir, I have no one to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up, but while I'm coming, another steps down before me.”

block.text: <<Tuhan, tidak ada orang yang menurunkan aku ke dalam kolam itu apabila airnya mulai goncang, dan sementara aku menuju ke kolam itu, orang lain sudah turun mendahului aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Arise, take up your mat, and walk.”

block.text: <<Bangunlah, angkatlah tilammu dan berjalanlah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately, the man was made well, and took up his mat and walked. Now it was the Sabbath on that day.

block.text: Dan pada saat itu juga sembuhlah orang itu lalu ia mengangkat tilamnya dan berjalan. Tetapi hari itu hari Sabat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So the Jews said to him who was cured,

block.text: Karena itu orang-orang Yahudi berkata kepada orang yang baru sembuh itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is the Sabbath. It is not lawful for you to carry the mat.”

block.text: <<Hari ini hari Sabat dan tidak boleh engkau memikul tilammu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: Akan tetapi ia menjawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He who made me well, the same said to me, ‘Take up your mat, and walk.’”

block.text: <<Orang yang telah menyembuhkan aku, dia yang mengatakan kepadaku: Angkatlah tilammu dan berjalanlah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they asked him,

block.text: Mereka bertanya kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who is the man who said to you, ‘Take up your mat, and walk’?”

block.text: <<Siapakah orang itu yang berkata kepadamu: Angkatlah tilammu dan berjalanlah?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he who was healed didn't know who it was, for Jesus had withdrawn, a crowd being in the place.

block.text: Tetapi orang yang baru sembuh itu tidak tahu siapa orang itu, sebab Yesus telah menghilang ke tengah-tengah orang banyak di tempat itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Afterward Jesus found him in the temple, and said to him,

block.text: Kemudian Yesus bertemu dengan dia dalam Bait Allah lalu berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, you are made well. Sin no more, so that nothing worse happens to you.”

block.text: <<Engkau telah sembuh; jangan berbuat dosa lagi, supaya padamu jangan terjadi yang lebih buruk.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The man went away, and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him well.

block.text: Orang itu keluar, lalu menceriterakan kepada orang-orang Yahudi, bahwa Yesuslah yang telah menyembuhkan dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this cause the Jews persecuted Jesus, and sought to kill him, because he did these things on the Sabbath.
But Jesus answered them,

block.text: Dan karena itu orang-orang Yahudi berusaha menganiaya Yesus, karena Ia melakukan hal-hal itu pada hari Sabat.
Tetapi Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My Father is still working so I, too, am working.”

block.text: <<Bapa-Ku bekerja sampai sekarang, maka Akupun bekerja juga.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this cause therefore the Jews sought all the more to kill him, because he not only broke the Sabbath, but also called God his own Father, making himself equal with God.

block.text: Sebab itu orang-orang Yahudi lebih berusaha lagi untuk membunuh-Nya, bukan saja karena Ia meniadakan hari Sabat, tetapi juga karena Ia mengatakan bahwa Allah adalah Bapa-Nya sendiri dan dengan demikian menyamakan diri-Nya dengan Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus therefore answered them,

block.text: Maka Yesus menjawab mereka, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly, I tell you, the Son can do nothing of himself, but what he sees the Father doing. For whatever things he does, these the Son also does likewise.

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya Anak tidak dapat mengerjakan sesuatu dari diri-Nya sendiri, jikalau tidak Ia melihat Bapa mengerjakannya; sebab apa yang dikerjakan Bapa, itu juga yang dikerjakan Anak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Father has affection for the Son, and shows him all things that he himself does. He will show him greater works than these, that you may marvel.

block.text: Sebab Bapa mengasihi Anak dan Ia menunjukkan kepada-Nya segala sesuatu yang dikerjakan-Nya sendiri, bahkan Ia akan menunjukkan kepada-Nya pekerjaan-pekerjaan yang lebih besar lagi dari pada pekerjaan-pekerjaan itu, sehingga kamu menjadi heran.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For as the Father raises the dead and gives them life, even so the Son also gives life to whom he desires.

block.text: <<Sebab sama seperti Bapa membangkitkan orang-orang mati dan menghidupkannya, demikian juga Anak menghidupkan barangsiapa yang dikehendaki-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Father judges no one, but he has given all judgment to the Son,
that all may honor the Son, even as they honor the Father. He who doesn't honor the Son doesn't honor the Father who sent him.”

block.text: Bapa tidak menghakimi siapapun, melainkan telah menyerahkan penghakiman itu seluruhnya kepada Anak,
supaya semua orang menghormati Anak sama seperti mereka menghormati Bapa. Barangsiapa tidak menghormati Anak, ia juga tidak menghormati Bapa, yang mengutus Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, he who hears my word, and believes him who sent me, has eternal life, and doesn't come into judgment, but has passed out of death into life.

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya barangsiapa mendengar perkataan-Ku dan percaya kepada Dia yang mengutus Aku, ia mempunyai hidup yang kekal dan tidak turut dihukum, sebab ia sudah pindah dari dalam maut ke dalam hidup.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly, I tell you, the hour comes, and now is, when the dead will hear the Son of God's voice; and those who hear will live.

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya saatnya akan tiba dan sudah tiba, bahwa orang-orang mati akan mendengar suara Anak Allah, dan mereka yang mendengarnya, akan hidup.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For as the Father has life in himself, even so he gave to the Son also to have life in himself.

block.text: Sebab sama seperti Bapa mempunyai hidup dalam diri-Nya sendiri, demikian juga diberikan-Nya Anak mempunyai hidup dalam diri-Nya sendiri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He also gave him authority to execute judgment, because he is a son of man.

block.text: Dan Ia telah memberikan kuasa kepada-Nya untuk menghakimi, karena Ia adalah Anak Manusia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don't marvel at this, for the hour comes, in which all that are in the tombs will hear his voice,
and will come out; those who have done good, to the resurrection of life; and those who have done evil, to the resurrection of damnation.

block.text: <<Janganlah kamu heran akan hal itu, sebab saatnya akan tiba, bahwa semua orang yang di dalam kuburan akan mendengar suara-Nya,
dan mereka yang telah berbuat baik akan keluar dan bangkit untuk hidup yang kekal, tetapi mereka yang telah berbuat jahat akan bangkit untuk dihukum.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I can of myself do nothing. As I hear, I judge, and my judgment is righteous; because I don't seek my own will, but the will of my Father who sent me.”

block.text: Aku tidak dapat berbuat apa-apa dari diri-Ku sendiri; Aku menghakimi sesuai dengan apa yang Aku dengar, dan penghakiman-Ku adil, sebab Aku tidak menuruti kehendak-Ku sendiri, melainkan kehendak Dia yang mengutus Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If I testify about myself, my witness is not valid.

block.text: <<Kalau Aku bersaksi tentang diri-Ku sendiri, maka kesaksian-Ku itu tidak benar;

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is another who testifies about me. I know that the testimony which he testifies about me is true.

block.text: ada yang lain yang bersaksi tentang Aku dan Aku tahu, bahwa kesaksian yang diberikan-Nya tentang Aku adalah benar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You have sent to John, and he has testified to the truth.

block.text: Kamu telah mengirim utusan kepada Yohanes dan ia telah bersaksi tentang kebenaran;

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the testimony which I receive is not from man. However, I say these things that you may be saved.

block.text: tetapi Aku tidak memerlukan kesaksian dari manusia, namun Aku mengatakan hal ini, supaya kamu diselamatkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: John was the burning and shining lamp, and you were willing to rejoice for a while in his light.

block.text: Ia adalah pelita yang menyala dan yang bercahaya dan kamu hanya mau menikmati seketika saja cahayanya itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the testimony which I have is greater than that of John, for the works which the Father gave me to accomplish, the very works that I do, testify about me, that the Father has sent me.

block.text: <<Tetapi Aku mempunyai suatu kesaksian yang lebih penting dari pada kesaksian Yohanes, yaitu segala pekerjaan yang diserahkan Bapa kepada-Ku, supaya Aku melaksanakannya. Pekerjaan itu juga yang Kukerjakan sekarang, dan itulah yang memberi kesaksian tentang Aku, bahwa Bapa yang mengutus Aku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Father himself, who sent me, has testified about me. You have neither heard his voice at any time, nor seen his form.

block.text: Bapa yang mengutus Aku, Dialah yang bersaksi tentang Aku. Kamu tidak pernah mendengar suara-Nya, rupa-Nyapun tidak pernah kamu lihat,

ReferenceBlocks.text: You don't have his word living in you; because you don't believe him whom he sent.”

block.text: dan firman-Nya tidak menetap di dalam dirimu, sebab kamu tidak percaya kepada Dia yang diutus-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You search the Scriptures, because you think that in them you have eternal life; and these are they which testify about me.

block.text: Kamu menyelidiki Kitab-kitab Suci, sebab kamu menyangka bahwa oleh-Nya kamu mempunyai hidup yang kekal, tetapi walaupun Kitab-kitab Suci itu memberi kesaksian tentang Aku,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Yet you will not come to me, that you may have life.
I don't receive glory from men.

block.text: namun kamu tidak mau datang kepada-Ku untuk memperoleh hidup itu.>>
<<Aku tidak memerlukan hormat dari manusia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I know you, that you don't have God's love in yourselves.

block.text: Tetapi tentang kamu, memang Aku tahu bahwa di dalam hatimu kamu tidak mempunyai kasih akan Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I have come in my Father's name, and you don't receive me. If another comes in his own name, you will receive him.

block.text: Aku datang dalam nama Bapa-Ku dan kamu tidak menerima Aku; jikalau orang lain datang atas namanya sendiri, kamu akan menerima dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: How can you believe, who receive glory from one another, and you don't seek the glory that comes from the only God?”

block.text: Bagaimanakah kamu dapat percaya, kamu yang menerima hormat seorang dari yang lain dan yang tidak mencari hormat yang datang dari Allah yang Esa?

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't think that I will accuse you to the Father. There is one who accuses you, even Moses, on whom you have set your hope.

block.text: Jangan kamu menyangka, bahwa Aku akan mendakwa kamu di hadapan Bapa; yang mendakwa kamu adalah Musa, yaitu Musa, yang kepadanya kamu menaruh pengharapanmu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if you believed Moses, you would believe me; for he wrote about me.

block.text: Sebab jikalau kamu percaya kepada Musa, tentu kamu akan percaya juga kepada-Ku, sebab ia telah menulis tentang Aku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if you don't believe his writings, how will you believe my words?”

block.text: Tetapi jikalau kamu tidak percaya akan apa yang ditulisnya, bagaimanakah kamu akan percaya akan apa yang Kukatakan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN CHP 6
After these things, Jesus went away to the other side of the sea of Galilee, which is also called the Sea of Tiberias.

block.text: Sesudah itu Yesus berangkat ke seberang danau Galilea, yaitu danau Tiberias.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A great multitude followed him, because they saw his signs which he did on those who were sick.

block.text: Orang banyak berbondong-bondong mengikuti Dia, karena mereka melihat mujizat-mujizat penyembuhan, yang diadakan-Nya terhadap orang-orang sakit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus went up into the mountain, and he sat there with his disciples.

block.text: Dan Yesus naik ke atas gunung dan duduk di situ dengan murid-murid-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now the Passover, the feast of the Jews, was at hand.

block.text: Dan Paskah, hari raya orang Yahudi, sudah dekat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus therefore lifting up his eyes, and seeing that a great multitude was coming to him, said to Philip,

block.text: Ketika Yesus memandang sekeliling-Nya dan melihat, bahwa orang banyak berbondong-bondong datang kepada-Nya, berkatalah Ia kepada Filipus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where are we to buy bread, that these may eat?”

block.text: <<Di manakah kita akan membeli roti, supaya mereka ini dapat makan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: This he said to test him, for he himself knew what he would do.

block.text: Hal itu dikatakan-Nya untuk mencobai dia, sebab Ia sendiri tahu, apa yang hendak dilakukan-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Philip answered him,

block.text: Jawab Filipus kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Two hundred denarii worth of bread is not sufficient for them, that everyone of them may receive a little.”

block.text: <<Roti seharga dua ratus dinar tidak akan cukup untuk mereka ini, sekalipun masing-masing mendapat sepotong kecil saja.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter's brother, said to him,

block.text: Seorang dari murid-murid-Nya, yaitu Andreas, saudara Simon Petrus, berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “There is a boy here who has five barley loaves and two fish, but what are these among so many?”

block.text: <<Di sini ada seorang anak, yang mempunyai lima roti jelai dan dua ikan; tetapi apakah artinya itu untuk orang sebanyak ini?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said,

block.text: Kata Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Have the people sit down.”

block.text: <<Suruhlah orang-orang itu duduk.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now there was much grass in that place. So the men sat down, in number about five thousand.

block.text: Adapun di tempat itu banyak rumput. Maka duduklah orang-orang itu, kira-kira lima ribu laki-laki banyaknya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus took the loaves; and having given thanks, he distributed to the disciples, and the disciples to those who were sitting down; likewise also of the fish as much as they desired.

block.text: Lalu Yesus mengambil roti itu, mengucap syukur dan membagi-bagikannya kepada mereka yang duduk di situ, demikian juga dibuat-Nya dengan ikan-ikan itu, sebanyak yang mereka kehendaki.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they were filled, he said to his disciples,

block.text: Dan setelah mereka kenyang Ia berkata kepada murid-murid-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Gather up the broken pieces which are left over, that nothing be lost.”

block.text: <<Kumpulkanlah potongan-potongan yang lebih supaya tidak ada yang terbuang.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So they gathered them up, and filled twelve baskets with broken pieces from the five barley loaves, which were left over by those who had eaten.

block.text: Maka merekapun mengumpulkannya, dan mengisi dua belas bakul penuh dengan potongan-potongan dari kelima roti jelai yang lebih setelah orang makan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When therefore the people saw the sign which Jesus did, they said,

block.text: Ketika orang-orang itu melihat mujizat yang telah diadakan-Nya, mereka berkata:

block.characterId: people in crowd by Sea of Galilee

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: people in crowd by Sea of Galilee
ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is truly the prophet who comes into the world.”

block.text: <<Dia ini adalah benar-benar nabi yang akan datang ke dalam dunia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus therefore, perceiving that they were about to come and take him by force, to make him king, withdrew again to the mountain by himself.

block.text: Karena Yesus tahu, bahwa mereka hendak datang dan hendak membawa Dia dengan paksa untuk menjadikan Dia raja, Ia menyingkir pula ke gunung, seorang diri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When evening came, his disciples went down to the sea,
and they entered into the boat, and were going over the sea to Capernaum.
It was now dark, and Jesus had not come to them.

block.text: Dan ketika hari sudah mulai malam, murid-murid Yesus pergi ke danau, lalu naik ke perahu
dan menyeberang ke Kapernaum.
Ketika hari sudah gelap Yesus belum juga datang mendapatkan mereka,

ReferenceBlocks.text: The sea was tossed by a great wind blowing.

block.text: sedang laut bergelora karena angin kencang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When therefore they had rowed about twenty-five or thirty stadia, they saw Jesus walking on the sea, and drawing near to the boat; and they were afraid.
But he said to them,

block.text: Sesudah mereka mendayung kira-kira dua tiga mil jauhnya, mereka melihat Yesus berjalan di atas air mendekati perahu itu. Maka ketakutanlah mereka.
Tetapi Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is I. Don't be afraid.”

block.text: <<Aku ini, jangan takut!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were willing therefore to receive him into the boat. Immediately the boat was at the land where they were going.

block.text: Mereka mau menaikkan Dia ke dalam perahu, dan seketika juga perahu itu sampai ke pantai yang mereka tujui.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the next day, the multitude that stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was no other boat there, except the one in which his disciples had embarked, and that Jesus hadn't entered with his disciples into the boat, but his disciples had gone away alone.

block.text: Pada keesokan harinya orang banyak, yang masih tinggal di seberang, melihat bahwa di situ tidak ada perahu selain dari pada yang satu tadi dan bahwa Yesus tidak turut naik ke perahu itu bersama-sama dengan murid-murid-Nya, dan bahwa murid-murid-Nya saja yang berangkat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: However boats from Tiberias came near to the place where they ate the bread after the Lord had given thanks.

block.text: Tetapi sementara itu beberapa perahu lain datang dari Tiberias dekat ke tempat mereka makan roti, sesudah Tuhan mengucapkan syukur atasnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the multitude therefore saw that Jesus wasn't there, nor his disciples, they themselves got into the boats, and came to Capernaum, seeking Jesus.

block.text: Ketika orang banyak melihat, bahwa Yesus tidak ada di situ dan murid-murid-Nya juga tidak, mereka naik ke perahu-perahu itu lalu berangkat ke Kapernaum untuk mencari Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they found him on the other side of the sea, they asked him,

block.text: Ketika orang banyak menemukan Yesus di seberang laut itu, mereka berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi, when did you come here?”

block.text: <<Rabi, bilamana Engkau tiba di sini?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Yesus menjawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, you seek me, not because you saw signs, but because you ate of the loaves, and were filled.

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya kamu mencari Aku, bukan karena kamu telah melihat tanda-tanda, melainkan karena kamu telah makan roti itu dan kamu kenyang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don't work for the food which perishes, but for the food which remains to eternal life, which the Son of Man will give to you. For God the Father has sealed him.”

block.text: Bekerjalah, bukan untuk makanan yang akan dapat binasa, melainkan untuk makanan yang bertahan sampai kepada hidup yang kekal, yang akan diberikan Anak Manusia kepadamu; sebab Dialah yang disahkan oleh Bapa, Allah, dengan meterai-Nya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said therefore to him,

block.text: Lalu kata mereka kepada-Nya:

block.characterId: people in crowd by Sea of Galilee

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: people in crowd by Sea of Galilee
ReferenceBlocks.text: “What must we do, that we may work the works of God?”

block.text: <<Apakah yang harus kami perbuat, supaya kami mengerjakan pekerjaan yang dikehendaki Allah?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is the work of God, that you believe in him whom he has sent.”

block.text: <<Inilah pekerjaan yang dikehendaki Allah, yaitu hendaklah kamu percaya kepada Dia yang telah diutus Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said therefore to him,

block.text: Maka kata mereka kepada-Nya:

block.characterId: people in crowd by Sea of Galilee

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: people in crowd by Sea of Galilee
ReferenceBlocks.text: “What then do you do for a sign, that we may see, and believe you? What work do you do?

block.text: <<Tanda apakah yang Engkau perbuat, supaya dapat kami melihatnya dan percaya kepada-Mu? Pekerjaan apakah yang Engkau lakukan?>>

block.characterId: people in crowd by Sea of Galilee

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: people in crowd by Sea of Galilee
ReferenceBlocks.text: Our fathers ate the manna in the wilderness. As it is written, ‘He gave them bread out of heaven to eat.’”

block.text: <<Nenek moyang kami telah makan manna di padang gurun, seperti ada tertulis: Mereka diberi-Nya makan roti dari sorga.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus therefore said to them,

block.text: Maka kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly, I tell you, it wasn't Moses who gave you the bread out of heaven, but my Father gives you the true bread out of heaven.

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya bukan Musa yang memberikan kamu roti dari sorga, melainkan Bapa-Ku yang memberikan kamu roti yang benar dari sorga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the bread of God is that which comes down out of heaven, and gives life to the world.”

block.text: Karena roti yang dari Allah ialah roti yang turun dari sorga dan yang memberi hidup kepada dunia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said therefore to him,

block.text: Maka kata mereka kepada-Nya:

block.characterId: people in crowd by Sea of Galilee

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: people in crowd by Sea of Galilee
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, always give us this bread.”

block.text: <<Tuhan, berikanlah kami roti itu senantiasa.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am the bread of life. He who comes to me will not be hungry, and he who believes in me will never be thirsty.

block.text: <<Akulah roti hidup; barangsiapa datang kepada-Ku, ia tidak akan lapar lagi, dan barangsiapa percaya kepada-Ku, ia tidak akan haus lagi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I told you that you have seen me, and yet you don't believe.

block.text: Tetapi Aku telah berkata kepadamu: Sungguhpun kamu telah melihat Aku, kamu tidak percaya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All those whom the Father gives me will come to me. He who comes to me I will in no way throw out.

block.text: Semua yang diberikan Bapa kepada-Ku akan datang kepada-Ku, dan barangsiapa datang kepada-Ku, ia tidak akan Kubuang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I have come down from heaven, not to do my own will, but the will of him who sent me.

block.text: Sebab Aku telah turun dari sorga bukan untuk melakukan kehendak-Ku, tetapi untuk melakukan kehendak Dia yang telah mengutus Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is the will of my Father who sent me, that of all he has given to me I should lose nothing, but should raise him up at the last day.

block.text: <<Dan Inilah kehendak Dia yang telah mengutus Aku, yaitu supaya dari semua yang telah diberikan-Nya kepada-Ku jangan ada yang hilang, tetapi supaya Kubangkitkan pada akhir zaman.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is the will of the one who sent me, that everyone who sees the Son, and believes in him, should have eternal life; and I will raise him up at the last day.”

block.text: Sebab inilah kehendak Bapa-Ku, yaitu supaya setiap orang, yang melihat Anak dan yang percaya kepada-Nya beroleh hidup yang kekal, dan supaya Aku membangkitkannya pada akhir zaman.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Jews therefore murmured concerning him, because he said,

block.text: Maka bersungut-sungutlah orang Yahudi tentang Dia, karena Ia telah mengatakan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am the bread which came down out of heaven.”

block.text: <<Akulah roti yang telah turun dari sorga.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Kata mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Isn't this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How then does he say, ‘I have come down out of heaven?’”

block.text: <<Bukankah Ia ini Yesus, anak Yusuf, yang ibu bapanya kita kenal?>> <<Bagaimana Ia dapat berkata: Aku telah turun dari sorga?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore Jesus answered them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't murmur among yourselves.

block.text: <<Jangan kamu bersungut-sungut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: No one can come to me unless the Father who sent me draws him, and I will raise him up in the last day.

block.text: Tidak ada seorangpun yang dapat datang kepada-Ku, jikalau ia tidak ditarik oleh Bapa yang mengutus Aku, dan ia akan Kubangkitkan pada akhir zaman.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is written in the prophets, ‘They will all be taught by God.’ Therefore everyone who hears from the Father, and has learned, comes to me.

block.text: Ada tertulis dalam kitab nabi-nabi: <Dan mereka semua akan diajar oleh Allah.> Dan setiap orang, yang telah mendengar dan menerima pengajaran dari Bapa, datang kepada-Ku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Not that anyone has seen the Father, except he who is from God. He has seen the Father.

block.text: Hal itu tidak berarti, bahwa ada orang yang telah melihat Bapa. Hanya Dia yang datang dari Allah, Dialah yang telah melihat Bapa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly, I tell you, he who believes on me has eternal life.

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya barangsiapa percaya, ia mempunyai hidup yang kekal.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: I am the bread of life.
Your fathers ate the manna in the wilderness, and they died.

block.text: <<Akulah roti hidup.
Nenek moyangmu telah makan manna di padang gurun dan mereka telah mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is the bread which comes down out of heaven, that anyone may eat of it and not die.

block.text: Inilah roti yang turun dari sorga: Barangsiapa makan dari padanya, ia tidak akan mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I am the living bread which came down out of heaven. If anyone eats of this bread, he will live forever. Yes, the bread which I will give for the life of the world is my flesh.”

block.text: Akulah roti hidup yang telah turun dari sorga. Jikalau seorang makan dari roti ini, ia akan hidup selama-lamanya, dan roti yang Kuberikan itu ialah daging-Ku, yang akan Kuberikan untuk hidup dunia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Jews therefore contended with one another, saying,

block.text: Orang-orang Yahudi bertengkar antara sesama mereka dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?”

block.text: <<Bagaimana Ia ini dapat memberikan daging-Nya kepada kita untuk dimakan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus therefore said to them,

block.text: Maka kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you don't have life in yourselves.

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya jikalau kamu tidak makan daging Anak Manusia dan minum darah-Nya, kamu tidak mempunyai hidup di dalam dirimu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up at the last day.

block.text: Barangsiapa makan daging-Ku dan minum darah-Ku, ia mempunyai hidup yang kekal dan Aku akan membangkitkan dia pada akhir zaman.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For my flesh is food indeed, and my blood is drink indeed.

block.text: Sebab daging-Ku adalah benar-benar makanan dan darah-Ku adalah benar-benar minuman.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who eats my flesh and drinks my blood lives in me, and I in him.

block.text: Barangsiapa makan daging-Ku dan minum darah-Ku, ia tinggal di dalam Aku dan Aku di dalam dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As the living Father sent me, and I live because of the Father; so he who feeds on me, he will also live because of me.

block.text: Sama seperti Bapa yang hidup mengutus Aku dan Aku hidup oleh Bapa, demikian juga barangsiapa yang memakan Aku, akan hidup oleh Aku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is the bread which came down out of heaven--not as our fathers ate the manna, and died. He who eats this bread will live forever.”

block.text: Inilah roti yang telah turun dari sorga, bukan roti seperti yang dimakan nenek moyangmu dan mereka telah mati. Barangsiapa makan roti ini, ia akan hidup selama-lamanya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said these things in the synagogue, as he taught in Capernaum.

block.text: Semuanya ini dikatakan Yesus di Kapernaum ketika Ia mengajar di rumah ibadat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore many of his disciples, when they heard this, said,

block.text: Sesudah mendengar semuanya itu banyak dari murid-murid Yesus yang berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is a hard saying! Who can listen to it?”

block.text: <<Perkataan ini keras, siapakah yang sanggup mendengarkannya?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus knowing in himself that his disciples murmured at this, said to them,

block.text: Yesus yang di dalam hati-Nya tahu, bahwa murid-murid-Nya bersungut-sungut tentang hal itu, berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Does this cause you to stumble?

block.text: <<Adakah perkataan itu menggoncangkan imanmu?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then what if you would see the Son of Man ascending to where he was before?

block.text: Dan bagaimanakah, jikalau kamu melihat Anak Manusia naik ke tempat di mana Ia sebelumnya berada?

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is the spirit who gives life. The flesh profits nothing. The words that I speak to you are spirit, and are life.

block.text: Rohlah yang memberi hidup, daging sama sekali tidak berguna. Perkataan-perkataan yang Kukatakan kepadamu adalah roh dan hidup.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But there are some of you who don't believe.”

block.text: Tetapi di antaramu ada yang tidak percaya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were who didn't believe, and who it was who would betray him.
He said,

block.text: Sebab Yesus tahu dari semula, siapa yang tidak percaya dan siapa yang akan menyerahkan Dia.
Lalu Ia berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “For this cause have I said to you that no one can come to me, unless it is given to him by my Father.”

block.text: <<Sebab itu telah Kukatakan kepadamu: Tidak ada seorangpun dapat datang kepada-Ku, kalau Bapa tidak mengaruniakannya kepadanya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: At this, many of his disciples went back, and walked no more with him.

block.text: Mulai dari waktu itu banyak murid-murid-Nya mengundurkan diri dan tidak lagi mengikut Dia.
