ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said therefore to the twelve,

block.text: Maka kata Yesus kepada kedua belas murid-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You don't also want to go away, do you?”

block.text: <<Apakah kamu tidak mau pergi juga?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon Peter answered him,

block.text: Jawab Simon Petrus kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, to whom would we go? You have the words of eternal life.

block.text: <<Tuhan, kepada siapakah kami akan pergi? Perkataan-Mu adalah perkataan hidup yang kekal;

ReferenceBlocks.text: We have come to believe and know that you are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”

block.text: dan kami telah percaya dan tahu, bahwa Engkau adalah Yang Kudus dari Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Didn't I choose you, the twelve, and yet one of you is a devil?”

block.text: <<Bukankah Aku sendiri yang telah memilih kamu yang dua belas ini? Namun seorang di antaramu adalah Iblis.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now he spoke of Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot, for it was he who would betray him, being one of the twelve.

block.text: Yang dimaksudkan-Nya ialah Yudas, anak Simon Iskariot; sebab dialah yang akan menyerahkan Yesus, dia seorang di antara kedua belas murid itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN CHP 7
After these things, Jesus was walking in Galilee, for he wouldn't walk in Judea, because the Jews sought to kill him.

block.text: Sesudah itu Yesus berjalan keliling Galilea, sebab Ia tidak mau tetap tinggal di Yudea, karena di sana orang-orang Yahudi berusaha untuk membunuh-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now the feast of the Jews, the Feast of Booths, was at hand.

block.text: Ketika itu sudah dekat hari raya orang Yahudi, yaitu hari raya Pondok Daun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: His brothers therefore said to him,

block.text: Maka kata saudara-saudara Yesus kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Depart from here, and go into Judea, that your disciples also may see your works which you do.

block.text: <<Berangkatlah dari sini dan pergi ke Yudea, supaya murid-murid-Mu juga melihat perbuatan-perbuatan yang Engkau lakukan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For no one does anything in secret, and himself seeks to be known openly. If you do these things, reveal yourself to the world.”

block.text: Sebab tidak seorangpun berbuat sesuatu di tempat tersembunyi, jika ia mau diakui di muka umum. Jikalau Engkau berbuat hal-hal yang demikian, tampakkanlah diri-Mu kepada dunia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For even his brothers didn't believe in him.
Jesus therefore said to them,

block.text: Sebab saudara-saudara-Nya sendiripun tidak percaya kepada-Nya.
Maka jawab Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My time has not yet come, but your time is always ready.

block.text: <<Waktu-Ku belum tiba, tetapi bagi kamu selalu ada waktu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The world can't hate you, but it hates me, because I testify about it, that its works are evil.

block.text: Dunia tidak dapat membenci kamu, tetapi ia membenci Aku, sebab Aku bersaksi tentang dia, bahwa pekerjaan-pekerjaannya jahat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You go up to the feast. I am not yet going up to this feast, because my time is not yet fulfilled.”

block.text: Pergilah kamu ke pesta itu. Aku belum pergi ke situ, karena waktu-Ku belum genap.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having said these things to them, he stayed in Galilee.

block.text: Demikianlah kata-Nya kepada mereka, dan Iapun tinggal di Galilea.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when his brothers had gone up to the feast, then he also went up, not publicly, but as it were in secret.

block.text: Tetapi sesudah saudara-saudara Yesus berangkat ke pesta itu, Iapun pergi juga ke situ, tidak terang-terangan tetapi diam-diam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Jews therefore sought him at the feast, and said,

block.text: Orang-orang Yahudi mencari Dia di pesta itu dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where is he?”

block.text: <<Di manakah Ia?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: There was much murmuring among the multitudes concerning him. Some said,

block.text: Dan banyak terdengar bisikan di antara orang banyak tentang Dia. Ada yang berkata:

block.characterId: crowd at Festival of Tabernacles in Jerusalem, some

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: crowd at Festival of Tabernacles in Jerusalem, some
ReferenceBlocks.text: “He is a good man.”

block.text: <<Ia orang baik.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others said,

block.text: Ada pula yang berkata:

block.characterId: crowd at Festival of Tabernacles in Jerusalem, others

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: crowd at Festival of Tabernacles in Jerusalem, others
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Not so. He leads people astray.”

block.text: <<Tidak, Ia menyesatkan rakyat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Yet no one spoke openly of him for fear of the Jews.

block.text: Tetapi tidak seorangpun yang berani berkata terang-terangan tentang Dia karena takut terhadap orang-orang Yahudi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when it was now the midst of the feast, Jesus went up into the temple and taught.

block.text: Waktu pesta itu sedang berlangsung, Yesus masuk ke Bait Allah lalu mengajar di situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Jews therefore marveled, saying,

block.text: Maka heranlah orang-orang Yahudi dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How does this man know letters, having never been educated?”

block.text: <<Bagaimanakah orang ini mempunyai pengetahuan demikian tanpa belajar!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus therefore answered them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My teaching is not mine, but his who sent me.

block.text: <<Ajaran-Ku tidak berasal dari diri-Ku sendiri, tetapi dari Dia yang telah mengutus Aku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If anyone desires to do his will, he will know about the teaching, whether it is from God, or if I am speaking from myself.

block.text: Barangsiapa mau melakukan kehendak-Nya, ia akan tahu entah ajaran-Ku ini berasal dari Allah, entah Aku berkata-kata dari diri-Ku sendiri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who speaks from himself seeks his own glory, but he who seeks the glory of him who sent him is true, and no unrighteousness is in him.

block.text: Barangsiapa berkata-kata dari dirinya sendiri, ia mencari hormat bagi dirinya sendiri, tetapi barangsiapa mencari hormat bagi Dia yang mengutusnya, ia benar dan tidak ada ketidakbenaran padanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Didn't Moses give you the law, and yet none of you keeps the law? Why do you seek to kill me?”

block.text: Bukankah Musa yang telah memberikan hukum Taurat kepadamu? Namun tidak seorangpun di antara kamu yang melakukan hukum Taurat itu. Mengapa kamu berusaha membunuh Aku?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The multitude answered,

block.text: Orang banyak itu menjawab:

block.characterId: crowd at Festival of Tabernacles in Jerusalem, the

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: crowd at Festival of Tabernacles in Jerusalem, the
ReferenceBlocks.text: “You have a demon! Who seeks to kill you?”

block.text: <<Engkau kerasukan setan; siapakah yang berusaha membunuh Engkau?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I did one work, and you all marvel because of it.

block.text: <<Hanya satu perbuatan yang Kulakukan dan kamu semua telah heran.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Moses has given you circumcision (not that it is of Moses, but of the fathers), and on the Sabbath you circumcise a boy.

block.text: Jadi: Musa menetapkan supaya kamu bersunat—sebenarnya sunat itu tidak berasal dari Musa, tetapi dari nenek moyang kita—dan kamu menyunat orang pada hari Sabat!

ReferenceBlocks.text: If a boy receives circumcision on the Sabbath, that the law of Moses may not be broken, are you angry with me, because I made a man completely healthy on the Sabbath?

block.text: Jikalau seorang menerima sunat pada hari Sabat, supaya jangan melanggar hukum Musa, mengapa kamu marah kepada-Ku, karena Aku menyembuhkan seluruh tubuh seorang manusia pada hari Sabat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don't judge according to appearance, but judge righteous judgment.”

block.text: Janganlah menghakimi menurut apa yang nampak, tetapi hakimilah dengan adil.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore some of them of Jerusalem said,

block.text: Beberapa orang Yerusalem berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Isn't this he whom they seek to kill?
Behold, he speaks openly, and they say nothing to him. Can it be that the rulers indeed know that this is truly the Christ?

block.text: <<Bukankah Dia ini yang mereka mau bunuh?
<<Dan lihatlah, Ia berbicara dengan leluasa dan mereka tidak mengatakan apa-apa kepada-Nya. Mungkinkah pemimpin kita benar-benar sudah tahu, bahwa Ia adalah Kristus?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: However we know where this man comes from, but when the Christ comes, no one will know where he comes from.”

block.text: <<Tetapi tentang orang ini kita tahu dari mana asal-Nya, tetapi bilamana Kristus datang, tidak ada seorangpun yang tahu dari mana asal-Nya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus therefore cried out in the temple, teaching and saying,

block.text: Waktu Yesus mengajar di Bait Allah, Ia berseru:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes you know me and you know where I am from. I have not come of myself, but he who sent me is true, whom you don't know.

block.text: <<Memang Aku kamu kenal dan kamu tahu dari mana asal-Ku; namun Aku datang bukan atas kehendak-Ku sendiri, tetapi Aku diutus oleh Dia yang benar yang tidak kamu kenal.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I know him, because I am from him, and he sent me.”

block.text: Aku kenal Dia, sebab Aku datang dari Dia dan Dialah yang mengutus Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They sought therefore to take him; but no one laid a hand on him, because his hour had not yet come.

block.text: Mereka berusaha menangkap Dia, tetapi tidak ada seorangpun yang menyentuh Dia, sebab saat-Nya belum tiba.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But of the multitude, many believed in him. They said,

block.text: Tetapi di antara orang banyak itu ada banyak yang percaya kepada-Nya dan mereka berkata:

block.characterId: crowd at Festival of Tabernacles in Jerusalem, many in the

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: crowd at Festival of Tabernacles in Jerusalem, many in the
ReferenceBlocks.text: “When the Christ comes, he won't do more signs than those which this man has done, will he?”

block.text: <<Apabila Kristus datang, mungkinkah Ia akan mengadakan lebih banyak mujizat dari pada yang telah diadakan oleh Dia ini?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Pharisees heard the multitude murmuring these things concerning him, and the chief priests and the Pharisees sent officers to arrest him.
Then Jesus said,

block.text: Orang-orang Farisi mendengar orang banyak membisikkan hal-hal itu mengenai Dia, dan karena itu imam-imam kepala dan orang-orang Farisi menyuruh penjaga-penjaga Bait Allah untuk menangkap-Nya.
Maka kata Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will be with you a little while longer, then I go to him who sent me.

block.text: <<Tinggal sedikit waktu saja Aku ada bersama kamu dan sesudah itu Aku akan pergi kepada Dia yang telah mengutus Aku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You will seek me, and won't find me; and where I am, you can't come.”

block.text: Kamu akan mencari Aku, tetapi tidak akan bertemu dengan Aku, sebab kamu tidak dapat datang ke tempat di mana Aku berada.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Jews therefore said among themselves,

block.text: Orang-orang Yahudi itu berkata seorang kepada yang lain:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where will this man go that we won't find him?

block.text: <<Ke manakah Ia akan pergi, sehingga kita tidak dapat bertemu dengan Dia?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Will he go to the Dispersion among the Greeks, and teach the Greeks?

block.text: Adakah maksud-Nya untuk pergi kepada mereka yang tinggal di perantauan, di antara orang Yunani, untuk mengajar orang Yunani?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: What is this word that he said, ‘You will seek me, and won't find me; and where I am, you can't come’?”

block.text: <<Apakah maksud perkataan yang diucapkan-Nya ini: Kamu akan mencari Aku, tetapi kamu tidak akan bertemu dengan Aku, dan: Kamu tidak dapat datang ke tempat di mana Aku berada?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now on the last and greatest day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried out,

block.text: Dan pada hari terakhir, yaitu pada puncak perayaan itu, Yesus berdiri dan berseru:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If anyone is thirsty, let him come to me and drink!
He who believes in me, as the Scripture has said, from within him will flow rivers of living water.”

block.text: <<Barangsiapa haus, baiklah ia datang kepada-Ku dan minum!
Barangsiapa percaya kepada-Ku, seperti yang dikatakan oleh Kitab Suci: Dari dalam hatinya akan mengalir aliran-aliran air hidup.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said this about the Spirit, which those believing in him were to receive. For the Holy Spirit was not yet given, because Jesus wasn't yet glorified.

block.text: Yang dimaksudkan-Nya ialah Roh yang akan diterima oleh mereka yang percaya kepada-Nya; sebab Roh itu belum datang, karena Yesus belum dimuliakan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many of the multitude therefore, when they heard these words, said,

block.text: Beberapa orang di antara orang banyak, yang mendengarkan perkataan-perkata itu, berkata:

block.characterId: crowd at Festival of Tabernacles in Jerusalem, some

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: crowd at Festival of Tabernacles in Jerusalem, some
ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is truly the prophet.”

block.text: <<Dia ini benar-benar nabi yang akan datang.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others said,

block.text: Yang lain berkata:

block.characterId: crowd at Festival of Tabernacles in Jerusalem, others

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: crowd at Festival of Tabernacles in Jerusalem, others
ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is the Christ.”

block.text: <<Ia ini Mesias.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But some said,

block.text: Tetapi yang lain lagi berkata:

block.characterId: crowd at Festival of Tabernacles in Jerusalem, still others

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: crowd at Festival of Tabernacles in Jerusalem, still others
ReferenceBlocks.text: “What, does the Christ come out of Galilee?

block.text: <<Bukan, Mesias tidak datang dari Galilea!

block.characterId: crowd at Festival of Tabernacles in Jerusalem, still others

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: crowd at Festival of Tabernacles in Jerusalem, still others
ReferenceBlocks.text: Hasn't the Scripture said that the Christ comes of the seed of David, and from Bethlehem, the village where David was?”

block.text: Karena Kitab Suci mengatakan, bahwa Mesias berasal dari keturunan Daud dan dari kampung Betlehem, tempat Daud dahulu tinggal.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So there arose a division in the multitude because of him.

block.text: Maka timbullah pertentangan di antara orang banyak karena Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of them would have arrested him, but no one laid hands on him.

block.text: Beberapa orang di antara mereka mau menangkap Dia, tetapi tidak ada seorangpun yang berani menyentuh-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The officers therefore came to the chief priests and Pharisees. The Pharisees said to them,

block.text: Maka penjaga-penjaga itu pergi kepada imam-imam kepala dan orang-orang Farisi, yang berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why didn't you bring him?”

block.text: <<Mengapa kamu tidak membawa-Nya?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The officers answered,

block.text: Jawab penjaga-penjaga itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “No man ever spoke like this man!”

block.text: <<Belum pernah seorang manusia berkata seperti orang itu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Pharisees therefore answered them,

block.text: Jawab orang-orang Farisi itu kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You aren't also led astray, are you?
Have any of the rulers believed in him, or of the Pharisees?

block.text: <<Adakah kamu juga disesatkan?
Adakah seorang di antara pemimpin-pemimpin yang percaya kepada-Nya, atau seorang di antara orang-orang Farisi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But this multitude that doesn't know the law is accursed.”

block.text: Tetapi orang banyak ini yang tidak mengenal hukum Taurat, terkutuklah mereka!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nicodemus (he who came to him by night, being one of them) said to them,

block.text: Nikodemus, seorang dari mereka, yang dahulu telah datang kepada-Nya, berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Does our law judge a man, unless it first hears from him personally and knows what he does?”

block.text: <<Apakah hukum Taurat kita menghukum seseorang, sebelum ia didengar dan sebelum orang mengetahui apa yang telah dibuat-Nya?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered him,

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you also from Galilee? Search, and see that no prophet has arisen out of Galilee.”

block.text: <<Apakah engkau juga orang Galilea? Selidikilah Kitab Suci dan engkau akan tahu bahwa tidak ada nabi yang datang dari Galilea.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everyone went to his own house.

block.text: Lalu mereka pulang, masing-masing ke rumahnya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN CHP 8
but Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.

block.text: tetapi Yesus pergi ke bukit Zaitun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now very early in the morning, he came again into the temple, and all the people came to him. He sat down, and taught them.

block.text: Pagi-pagi benar Ia berada lagi di Bait Allah, dan seluruh rakyat datang kepada-Nya. Ia duduk dan mengajar mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The scribes and the Pharisees brought a woman taken in adultery. Having set her in the midst,
they told him,

block.text: Maka ahli-ahli Taurat dan orang-orang Farisi membawa kepada-Nya seorang perempuan yang kedapatan berbuat zinah.
Mereka menempatkan perempuan itu di tengah-tengah lalu berkata kepada Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, we found this woman in adultery, in the very act.

block.text: <<Rabi, perempuan ini tertangkap basah ketika ia sedang berbuat zinah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now in our law, Moses commanded us to stone such. What then do you say about her?”

block.text: Musa dalam hukum Taurat memerintahkan kita untuk melempari perempuan-perempuan yang demikian. Apakah pendapat-Mu tentang hal itu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said this testing him, that they might have something to accuse him of. But Jesus stooped down, and wrote on the ground with his finger.

block.text: Mereka mengatakan hal itu untuk mencobai Dia, supaya mereka memperoleh sesuatu untuk menyalahkan-Nya. Tetapi Yesus membungkuk lalu menulis dengan jari-Nya di tanah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when they continued asking him, he looked up and said to them,

block.text: Dan ketika mereka terus-menerus bertanya kepada-Nya, Iapun bangkit berdiri lalu berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He who is without sin among you, let him throw the first stone at her.”

block.text: <<Barangsiapa di antara kamu tidak berdosa, hendaklah ia yang pertama melemparkan batu kepada perempuan itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again he stooped down, and with his finger wrote on the ground.

block.text: Lalu Ia membungkuk pula dan menulis di tanah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They, when they heard it, being convicted by their conscience, went out one by one, beginning from the oldest, even to the last. Jesus was left alone with the woman where she was, in the middle.

block.text: Tetapi setelah mereka mendengar perkataan itu, pergilah mereka seorang demi seorang, mulai dari yang tertua. Akhirnya tinggallah Yesus seorang diri dengan perempuan itu yang tetap di tempatnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, standing up, saw her and said,

block.text: Lalu Yesus bangkit berdiri dan berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woman, where are your accusers? Did no one condemn you?”

block.text: <<Hai perempuan, di manakah mereka? Tidak adakah seorang yang menghukum engkau?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: She said,

block.text: Jawabnya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “No one, Lord.”

block.text: <<Tidak ada, Tuhan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said,

block.text: Lalu kata Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Neither do I condemn you. Go your way. From now on, sin no more.”

block.text: <<Akupun tidak menghukum engkau. Pergilah, dan jangan berbuat dosa lagi mulai dari sekarang.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again, therefore, Jesus spoke to them, saying,

block.text: Maka Yesus berkata pula kepada orang banyak, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am the light of the world. He who follows me will not walk in the darkness, but will have the light of life.”

block.text: <<Akulah terang dunia; barangsiapa mengikut Aku, ia tidak akan berjalan dalam kegelapan, melainkan ia akan mempunyai terang hidup.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Pharisees therefore said to him,

block.text: Kata orang-orang Farisi kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You testify about yourself. Your testimony is not valid.”

block.text: <<Engkau bersaksi tentang diri-Mu, kesaksian-Mu tidak benar.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus kepada mereka, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Even if I do testify about myself, my testimony is true because I know where I came from, and where I am going; but you don't know where I came from or where I am going.

block.text: <<Biarpun Aku bersaksi tentang diri-Ku sendiri, namun kesaksian-Ku itu benar, sebab Aku tahu, dari mana Aku datang dan ke mana Aku pergi. Tetapi kamu tidak tahu, dari mana Aku datang dan ke mana Aku pergi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You judge according to the flesh. I judge no one.

block.text: Kamu menghakimi menurut ukuran manusia, Aku tidak menghakimi seorangpun,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Yet even if I do judge, my judgment is true for I am not alone, but I am with the Father who sent me.

block.text: dan jikalau Aku menghakimi, maka penghakiman-Ku itu benar, sebab Aku tidak seorang diri, tetapi Aku bersama dengan Dia yang mengutus Aku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It's also written in your law that the testimony of two people is valid.

block.text: Dan dalam kitab Tauratmu ada tertulis, bahwa kesaksian dua orang adalah sah;

ReferenceBlocks.text: I am one who testifies about myself, and the Father who sent me also testifies about me.”

block.text: Akulah yang bersaksi tentang diri-Ku sendiri, dan juga Bapa, yang mengutus Aku, bersaksi tentang Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said therefore to him,

block.text: Maka kata mereka kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where is your Father?”

block.text: <<Di manakah Bapa-Mu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You know neither me, nor my Father. If you knew me, you would know my Father also.”

block.text: <<Baik Aku, maupun Bapa-Ku tidak kamu kenal. Jikalau sekiranya kamu mengenal Aku, kamu mengenal juga Bapa-Ku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus spoke these words in the treasury, as he taught in the temple. Yet no one arrested him, because his hour had not yet come.

block.text: Kata-kata itu dikatakan Yesus dekat perbendaharaan, waktu Ia mengajar di dalam Bait Allah. Dan tidak seorangpun yang menangkap Dia, karena saat-Nya belum tiba.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said therefore again to them,

block.text: Maka Yesus berkata pula kepada orang banyak:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am going away, and you will seek me, and you will die in your sins. Where I go, you can't come.”

block.text: <<Aku akan pergi dan kamu akan mencari Aku tetapi kamu akan mati dalam dosamu. Ke tempat Aku pergi, tidak mungkin kamu datang.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Jews therefore said,

block.text: Maka kata orang-orang Yahudi itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Will he kill himself, that he says, ‘Where I am going, you can't come?’”

block.text: <<Apakah Ia mau bunuh diri dan karena itu dikatakan-Nya: <Ke tempat Aku pergi, tidak mungkin kamu datang?> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Lalu Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are from beneath. I am from above. You are of this world. I am not of this world.

block.text: <<Kamu berasal dari bawah, Aku dari atas; kamu dari dunia ini, Aku bukan dari dunia ini.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I said therefore to you that you will die in your sins; for unless you believe that I am he, you will die in your sins.”

block.text: Karena itu tadi Aku berkata kepadamu, bahwa kamu akan mati dalam dosamu; sebab jikalau kamu tidak percaya, bahwa Akulah Dia, kamu akan mati dalam dosamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said therefore to him,

block.text: Maka kata mereka kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who are you?”

block.text: <<Siapakah Engkau?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Just what I have been saying to you from the beginning.

block.text: <<Apakah gunanya lagi Aku berbicara dengan kamu?

ReferenceBlocks.text: I have many things to speak and to judge concerning you. However he who sent me is true; and the things which I heard from him, these I say to the world.”

block.text: Banyak yang harus Kukatakan dan Kuhakimi tentang kamu; akan tetapi Dia, yang mengutus Aku, adalah benar, dan apa yang Kudengar dari pada-Nya, itu yang Kukatakan kepada dunia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They didn't understand that he spoke to them about the Father.
Jesus therefore said to them,

block.text: Mereka tidak mengerti, bahwa Ia berbicara kepada mereka tentang Bapa.
Maka kata Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When you have lifted up the Son of Man, then you will know that I am he, and I do nothing of myself, but as my Father taught me, I say these things.

block.text: <<Apabila kamu telah meninggikan Anak Manusia, barulah kamu tahu, bahwa Akulah Dia, dan bahwa Aku tidak berbuat apa-apa dari diri-Ku sendiri, tetapi Aku berbicara tentang hal-hal, sebagaimana diajarkan Bapa kepada-Ku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who sent me is with me. The Father hasn't left me alone, for I always do the things that are pleasing to him.”

block.text: Dan Ia, yang telah mengutus Aku, Ia menyertai Aku. Ia tidak membiarkan Aku sendiri, sebab Aku senantiasa berbuat apa yang berkenan kepada-Nya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he spoke these things, many believed in him.

block.text: Setelah Yesus mengatakan semuanya itu, banyak orang percaya kepada-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus therefore said to those Jews who had believed him,

block.text: Maka kata-Nya kepada orang-orang Yahudi yang percaya kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you remain in my word, then you are truly my disciples.

block.text: <<Jikalau kamu tetap dalam firman-Ku, kamu benar-benar adalah murid-Ku

ReferenceBlocks.text: You will know the truth, and the truth will make you free.”

block.text: dan kamu akan mengetahui kebenaran, dan kebenaran itu akan memerdekakan kamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered him,

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We are Abraham's seed, and have never been in bondage to anyone. How do you say, ‘You will be made free?’”

block.text: <<Kami adalah keturunan Abraham dan tidak pernah menjadi hamba siapapun. Bagaimana Engkau dapat berkata: Kamu akan merdeka?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, everyone who commits sin is the bondservant of sin.

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya setiap orang yang berbuat dosa, adalah hamba dosa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A bondservant doesn't live in the house forever. A son remains forever.

block.text: Dan hamba tidak tetap tinggal dalam rumah, tetapi anak tetap tinggal dalam rumah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If therefore the Son makes you free, you will be free indeed.

block.text: Jadi apabila Anak itu memerdekakan kamu, kamupun benar-benar merdeka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I know that you are Abraham's seed, yet you seek to kill me, because my word finds no place in you.

block.text: Aku tahu, bahwa kamu adalah keturunan Abraham, tetapi kamu berusaha untuk membunuh Aku karena firman-Ku tidak beroleh tempat di dalam kamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I say the things which I have seen with my Father; and you also do the things which you have seen with your father.”

block.text: Apa yang Kulihat pada Bapa, itulah yang Kukatakan, dan demikian juga kamu perbuat tentang apa yang kamu dengar dari bapamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered him,

block.text: Jawab mereka kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Our father is Abraham.”

block.text: <<Bapa kami ialah Abraham.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you were Abraham's children, you would do the works of Abraham.

block.text: <<Jikalau sekiranya kamu anak-anak Abraham, tentulah kamu mengerjakan pekerjaan yang dikerjakan oleh Abraham.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But now you seek to kill me, a man who has told you the truth, which I heard from God. Abraham didn't do this.

block.text: Tetapi yang kamu kerjakan ialah berusaha membunuh Aku; Aku, seorang yang mengatakan kebenaran kepadamu, yaitu kebenaran yang Kudengar dari Allah; pekerjaan yang demikian tidak dikerjakan oleh Abraham.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You do the works of your father.”

block.text: Kamu mengerjakan pekerjaan bapamu sendiri.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We were not born of sexual immorality. We have one Father, God.”

block.text: <<Kami tidak dilahirkan dari zinah. Bapa kami satu, yaitu Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore Jesus said to them,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If God were your father, you would love me, for I came out and have come from God. For I haven't come of myself, but he sent me.

block.text: <<Jikalau Allah adalah Bapamu, kamu akan mengasihi Aku, sebab Aku keluar dan datang dari Allah. Dan Aku datang bukan atas kehendak-Ku sendiri, melainkan Dialah yang mengutus Aku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Why don't you understand my speech? Because you can't hear my word.

block.text: Apakah sebabnya kamu tidak mengerti bahasa-Ku? Sebab kamu tidak dapat menangkap firman-Ku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: You are of your father, the devil, and you want to do the desires of your father. He was a murderer from the beginning, and doesn't stand in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaks a lie, he speaks on his own; for he is a liar, and the father of lies.

block.text: <<Iblislah yang menjadi bapamu dan kamu ingin melakukan keinginan-keinginan bapamu. Ia adalah pembunuh manusia sejak semula dan tidak hidup dalam kebenaran, sebab di dalam dia tidak ada kebenaran. Apabila ia berkata dusta, ia berkata atas kehendaknya sendiri, sebab ia adalah pendusta dan bapa segala dusta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But because I tell the truth, you don't believe me.

block.text: Tetapi karena Aku mengatakan kebenaran kepadamu, kamu tidak percaya kepada-Ku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Which of you convicts me of sin? If I tell the truth, why do you not believe me?

block.text: Siapakah di antaramu yang membuktikan bahwa Aku berbuat dosa? Apabila Aku mengatakan kebenaran, mengapakah kamu tidak percaya kepada-Ku?

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who is of God hears the words of God. For this cause you don't hear, because you are not of God.”

block.text: Barangsiapa berasal dari Allah, ia mendengarkan firman Allah; itulah sebabnya kamu tidak mendengarkannya, karena kamu tidak berasal dari Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the Jews answered him,

block.text: Orang-orang Yahudi menjawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Aren't we right when we say that you are a Samaritan, and have a demon?”

block.text: <<Bukankah benar kalau kami katakan bahwa Engkau orang Samaria dan kerasukan setan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I don't have a demon, but I honor my Father, and you dishonor me.

block.text: <<Aku tidak kerasukan setan, tetapi Aku menghormati Bapa-Ku dan kamu tidak menghormati Aku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I don't seek my own glory. There is one who seeks and judges.

block.text: Tetapi Aku tidak mencari hormat bagi-Ku: ada Satu yang mencarinya dan Dia juga yang menghakimi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly, I tell you, if a person keeps my word, he will never see death.”

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya barangsiapa menuruti firman-Ku, ia tidak akan mengalami maut sampai selama-lamanya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the Jews said to him,

block.text: Kata orang-orang Yahudi kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now we know that you have a demon. Abraham died, and the prophets; and you say, ‘If a man keeps my word, he will never taste of death.’

block.text: <<Sekarang kami tahu, bahwa Engkau kerasukan setan. Sebab Abraham telah mati dan demikian juga nabi-nabi, namun Engkau berkata: Barangsiapa menuruti firman-Ku, ia tidak akan mengalami maut sampai selama-lamanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Are you greater than our father, Abraham, who died? The prophets died. Who do you make yourself out to be?”

block.text: Adakah Engkau lebih besar dari pada bapa kita Abraham, yang telah mati! Nabi-nabipun telah mati; dengan siapakah Engkau samakan diri-Mu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If I glorify myself, my glory is nothing. It is my Father who glorifies me, of whom you say that he is our God.

block.text: <<Jikalau Aku memuliakan diri-Ku sendiri, maka kemuliaan-Ku itu sedikitpun tidak ada artinya. Bapa-Kulah yang memuliakan Aku, tentang siapa kamu berkata: Dia adalah Allah kami,

ReferenceBlocks.text: You have not known him, but I know him. If I said, ‘I don't know him,’ I would be like you, a liar. But I know him, and keep his word.

block.text: padahal kamu tidak mengenal Dia, tetapi Aku mengenal Dia. Dan jika Aku berkata: Aku tidak mengenal Dia, maka Aku adalah pendusta, sama seperti kamu, tetapi Aku mengenal Dia dan Aku menuruti firman-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Your father Abraham rejoiced to see my day. He saw it, and was glad.”

block.text: Abraham bapamu bersukacita bahwa ia akan melihat hari-Ku dan ia telah melihatnya dan ia bersukacita.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Jews therefore said to him,

block.text: Maka kata orang-orang Yahudi itu kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are not yet fifty years old, and have you seen Abraham?”

block.text: <<Umur-Mu belum sampai lima puluh tahun dan Engkau telah melihat Abraham?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly, I tell you, before Abraham came into existence, I AM.”

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya sebelum Abraham jadi, Aku telah ada.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore they took up stones to throw at him, but Jesus was hidden, and went out of the temple, having gone through their midst, and so passed by.

block.text: Lalu mereka mengambil batu untuk melempari Dia; tetapi Yesus menghilang dan meninggalkan Bait Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN CHP 9
As he passed by, he saw a man blind from birth.
His disciples asked him,

block.text: Waktu Yesus sedang lewat, Ia melihat seorang yang buta sejak lahirnya.
Murid-murid-Nya bertanya kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?”

block.text: <<Rabi, siapakah yang berbuat dosa, orang ini sendiri atau orang tuanya, sehingga ia dilahirkan buta?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Neither did this man sin, nor his parents; but, that the works of God might be revealed in him.

block.text: <<Bukan dia dan bukan juga orang tuanya, tetapi karena pekerjaan-pekerjaan Allah harus dinyatakan di dalam dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I must work the works of him who sent me, while it is day. The night is coming, when no one can work.

block.text: Kita harus mengerjakan pekerjaan Dia yang mengutus Aku, selama masih siang; akan datang malam, di mana tidak ada seorangpun yang dapat bekerja.

ReferenceBlocks.text: While I am in the world, I am the light of the world.”

block.text: Selama Aku di dalam dunia, Akulah terang dunia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said this, he spat on the ground, made mud with the saliva, anointed the blind man's eyes with the mud,
and said to him,

block.text: Setelah Ia mengatakan semuanya itu, Ia meludah ke tanah, dan mengaduk ludahnya itu dengan tanah, lalu mengoleskannya pada mata orang buta tadi
dan berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go, wash in the pool of Siloam”

block.text: <<Pergilah, basuhlah dirimu dalam kolam Siloam.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: (which means “Sent”). So he went away, washed, and came back seeing.

block.text: Siloam artinya: <<Yang diutus.>> Maka pergilah orang itu, ia membasuh dirinya lalu kembali dengan matanya sudah melek.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The neighbors therefore, and those who saw that he was blind before, said,

block.text: Tetapi tetangga-tetangganya dan mereka, yang dahulu mengenalnya sebagai pengemis, berkata:

block.characterId: neighbors of man blind from birth

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: neighbors of man blind from birth
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Isn't this he who sat and begged?”

block.text: <<Bukankah dia ini, yang selalu mengemis?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others were saying,

block.text: Ada yang berkata:

block.characterId: neighbors of man blind from birth, others

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: neighbors of man blind from birth, others
ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is he.”

block.text: <<Benar, dialah ini.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Still others were saying,

block.text: Ada pula yang berkata:

block.characterId: neighbors of man blind from birth, some

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: neighbors of man blind from birth, some
ReferenceBlocks.text: “He looks like him.”

block.text: <<Bukan, tetapi ia serupa dengan dia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Orang itu sendiri berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am he.”

block.text: <<Benar, akulah itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They therefore were asking him,

block.text: Kata mereka kepadanya:

block.characterId: neighbors of man blind from birth

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: neighbors of man blind from birth
ReferenceBlocks.text: “How were your eyes opened?”

block.text: <<Bagaimana matamu menjadi melek?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered,

block.text: Jawabnya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A man called Jesus made mud, anointed my eyes, and said to me, ‘Go to the pool of Siloam, and wash.’ So I went away and washed, and I received sight.”

block.text: <<Orang yang disebut Yesus itu mengaduk tanah, mengoleskannya pada mataku dan berkata kepadaku: Pergilah ke Siloam dan basuhlah dirimu. Lalu aku pergi dan setelah aku membasuh diriku, aku dapat melihat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they asked him,

block.text: Lalu mereka berkata kepadanya:

block.characterId: neighbors of man blind from birth

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: neighbors of man blind from birth
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where is he?”

block.text: <<Di manakah Dia?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Jawabnya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I don't know.”

block.text: <<Aku tidak tahu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought him who had been blind to the Pharisees.

block.text: Lalu mereka membawa orang yang tadinya buta itu kepada orang-orang Farisi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It was a Sabbath when Jesus made the mud and opened his eyes.

block.text: Adapun hari waktu Yesus mengaduk tanah dan memelekkan mata orang itu, adalah hari Sabat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore the Pharisees asked him:

block.text: Karena itu orang-orang Farisipun bertanya kepadanya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How did you receive your sight?”

block.text: bagaimana matanya menjadi melek.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Jawabnya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He put mud on my eyes, I washed, and I see.”

block.text: <<Ia mengoleskan adukan tanah pada mataku, lalu aku membasuh diriku, dan sekarang aku dapat melihat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of the Pharisees said,

block.text: Maka kata sebagian orang-orang Farisi itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man is not from God, because he doesn't keep the Sabbath.”

block.text: <<Orang ini tidak datang dari Allah, sebab Ia tidak memelihara hari Sabat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others said,

block.text: Sebagian pula berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How can a man who is a sinner do such signs?”

block.text: <<Bagaimanakah seorang berdosa dapat membuat mujizat yang demikian?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: There was division among them.

block.text: Maka timbullah pertentangan di antara mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore they asked the blind man again,

block.text: Lalu kata mereka pula kepada orang buta itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do you say about him, because he opened your eyes?”

block.text: <<Dan engkau, apakah katamu tentang Dia, karena Ia telah memelekkan matamu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Jawabnya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He is a prophet.”

block.text: <<Ia adalah seorang nabi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Jews therefore did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind, and had received his sight, until they called the parents of him who had received his sight,
and asked them,

block.text: Tetapi orang-orang Yahudi itu tidak percaya, bahwa tadinya ia buta dan baru dapat melihat lagi, sampai mereka memanggil orang tuanya
dan bertanya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is this your son, whom you say was born blind? How then does he now see?”

block.text: <<Inikah anakmu, yang kamu katakan bahwa ia lahir buta? Kalau begitu bagaimanakah ia sekarang dapat melihat?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: His parents answered them,

block.text: Jawab orang tua itu:

block.characterId: parents of cured man, blind from birth

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: parents of cured man, blind from birth
ReferenceBlocks.text: “We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind;

block.text: <<Yang kami tahu ialah, bahwa dia ini anak kami dan bahwa ia lahir buta,>>

block.characterId: parents of cured man, blind from birth

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: parents of cured man, blind from birth
ReferenceBlocks.text: but how he now sees, we don't know; or who opened his eyes, we don't know. He is of age. Ask him. He will speak for himself.”

block.text: <<tetapi bagaimana ia sekarang dapat melihat, kami tidak tahu, dan siapa yang memelekkan matanya, kami tidak tahu juga. Tanyakanlah kepadanya sendiri, ia sudah dewasa, ia dapat berkata-kata untuk dirinya sendiri.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: His parents said these things because they feared the Jews; for the Jews had already agreed that if any man would confess him as Christ, he would be put out of the synagogue.

block.text: Orang tuanya berkata demikian, karena mereka takut kepada orang-orang Yahudi, sebab orang-orang Yahudi itu telah sepakat bahwa setiap orang yang mengaku Dia sebagai Mesias, akan dikucilkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: That is why his parents said, “He is of age. Ask him.”

block.text: Itulah sebabnya maka orang tuanya berkata: <<Ia telah dewasa, tanyakanlah kepadanya sendiri.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So they called the man who was blind a second time, and said to him,

block.text: Lalu mereka memanggil sekali lagi orang yang tadinya buta itu dan berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Give glory to God. We know that this man is a sinner.”

block.text: <<Katakanlah kebenaran di hadapan Allah; kami tahu bahwa orang itu orang berdosa.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He therefore answered,

block.text: Jawabnya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I don't know if he is a sinner. One thing I do know: that though I was blind, now I see.”

block.text: <<Apakah orang itu orang berdosa, aku tidak tahu; tetapi satu hal aku tahu, yaitu bahwa aku tadinya buta, dan sekarang dapat melihat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him again,

block.text: Kata mereka kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What did he do to you? How did he open your eyes?”

block.text: <<Apakah yang diperbuat-Nya padamu? Bagaimana Ia memelekkan matamu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: Jawabnya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I told you already, and you didn't listen. Why do you want to hear it again? You don't also want to become his disciples, do you?”

block.text: <<Telah kukatakan kepadamu, dan kamu tidak mendengarkannya; mengapa kamu hendak mendengarkannya lagi? Barangkali kamu mau menjadi murid-Nya juga?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They insulted him and said,

block.text: Sambil mengejek mereka berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are his disciple, but we are disciples of Moses.

block.text: <<Engkau murid orang itu tetapi kami murid-murid Musa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We know that God has spoken to Moses. But as for this man, we don't know where he comes from.”

block.text: Kami tahu, bahwa Allah telah berfirman kepada Musa, tetapi tentang Dia itu kami tidak tahu dari mana Ia datang.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The man answered them,

block.text: Jawab orang itu kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How amazing! You don't know where he comes from, yet he opened my eyes.

block.text: <<Aneh juga bahwa kamu tidak tahu dari mana Ia datang, sedangkan Ia telah memelekkan mataku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We know that God doesn't listen to sinners, but if anyone is a worshipper of God, and does his will, he listens to him.

block.text: Kita tahu, bahwa Allah tidak mendengarkan orang-orang berdosa, melainkan orang-orang yang saleh dan yang melakukan kehendak-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Since the world began it has never been heard of that anyone opened the eyes of someone born blind.

block.text: Dari dahulu sampai sekarang tidak pernah terdengar, bahwa ada orang yang memelekkan mata orang yang lahir buta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If this man were not from God, he could do nothing.”

block.text: Jikalau orang itu tidak datang dari Allah, Ia tidak dapat berbuat apa-apa.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered him,

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You were altogether born in sins, and do you teach us?”

block.text: <<Engkau ini lahir sama sekali dalam dosa dan engkau hendak mengajar kami?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They threw him out.

block.text: Lalu mereka mengusir dia ke luar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus heard that they had thrown him out, and finding him, he said,

block.text: Yesus mendengar bahwa ia telah diusir ke luar oleh mereka. Kemudian Ia bertemu dengan dia dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you believe in the Son of God?”

block.text: <<Percayakah engkau kepada Anak Manusia?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered,

block.text: Jawabnya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who is he, Lord, that I may believe in him?”

block.text: <<Siapakah Dia, Tuhan? Supaya aku percaya kepada-Nya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You have both seen him, and it is he who speaks with you.”

block.text: <<Engkau bukan saja melihat Dia; tetapi Dia yang sedang berkata-kata dengan engkau, Dialah itu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Lalu ia sujud menyembah-Nya. Katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, I believe!”

block.text: <<Aku percaya, Tuhan!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: and he worshiped him.
Jesus said,

block.text: Kata Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I came into this world for judgment, that those who don't see may see; and that those who see may become blind.”

block.text: <<Aku datang ke dalam dunia untuk menghakimi, supaya barangsiapa yang tidak melihat, dapat melihat, dan supaya barangsiapa yang dapat melihat, menjadi buta.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those of the Pharisees who were with him heard these things, and said to him,

block.text: Kata-kata itu didengar oleh beberapa orang Farisi yang berada di situ dan mereka berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are we also blind?”

block.text: <<Apakah itu berarti bahwa kami juga buta?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you were blind, you would have no sin; but now you say, ‘We see.’ Therefore your sin remains.”

block.text: <<Sekiranya kamu buta, kamu tidak berdosa, tetapi karena kamu berkata: Kami melihat, maka tetaplah dosamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN CHP 10
Jesus said to them:

block.text: Jawab

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly, I tell you, one who doesn't enter by the door into the sheep fold, but climbs up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya siapa yang masuk ke dalam kandang domba dengan tidak melalui pintu, tetapi dengan memanjat tembok, ia adalah seorang pencuri dan seorang perampok;

ReferenceBlocks.text: But one who enters in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.

block.text: tetapi siapa yang masuk melalui pintu, ia adalah gembala domba.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The gatekeeper opens the gate for him, and the sheep listen to his voice. He calls his own sheep by name, and leads them out.

block.text: Untuk dia penjaga membuka pintu dan domba-domba mendengarkan suaranya dan ia memanggil domba-dombanya masing-masing menurut namanya dan menuntunnya ke luar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whenever he brings out his own sheep, he goes before them, and the sheep follow him, for they know his voice.

block.text: Jika semua dombanya telah dibawanya ke luar, ia berjalan di depan mereka dan domba-domba itu mengikuti dia, karena mereka mengenal suaranya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will by no means follow a stranger, but will flee from him; for they don't know the voice of strangers.”

block.text: Tetapi seorang asing pasti tidak mereka ikuti, malah mereka lari dari padanya, karena suara orang-orang asing tidak mereka kenal.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus spoke this parable to them, but they didn't understand what he was telling them.
Jesus therefore said to them again,

block.text: Itulah yang dikatakan Yesus dalam perumpamaan kepada mereka, tetapi mereka tidak mengerti apa maksudnya Ia berkata demikian kepada mereka.
Maka kata Yesus sekali lagi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly, I tell you, I am the sheep's door.

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya Akulah pintu ke domba-domba itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All who came before me are thieves and robbers, but the sheep didn't listen to them.

block.text: Semua orang yang datang sebelum Aku, adalah pencuri dan perampok, dan domba-domba itu tidak mendengarkan mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I am the door. If anyone enters in by me, he will be saved, and will go in and go out, and will find pasture.

block.text: Akulah pintu; barangsiapa masuk melalui Aku, ia akan selamat dan ia akan masuk dan keluar dan menemukan padang rumput.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The thief only comes to steal, kill, and destroy. I came that they may have life, and may have it abundantly.

block.text: Pencuri datang hanya untuk mencuri dan membunuh dan membinasakan; Aku datang, supaya mereka mempunyai hidup, dan mempunyainya dalam segala kelimpahan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.

block.text: <<Akulah gembala yang baik. Gembala yang baik memberikan nyawanya bagi domba-dombanya;

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who is a hired hand, and not a shepherd, who doesn't own the sheep, sees the wolf coming, leaves the sheep, and flees. The wolf snatches the sheep, and scatters them.

block.text: sedangkan seorang upahan yang bukan gembala, dan yang bukan pemilik domba-domba itu sendiri, ketika melihat serigala datang, meninggalkan domba-domba itu lalu lari, sehingga serigala itu menerkam dan mencerai-beraikan domba-domba itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The hired hand flees because he is a hired hand, and doesn't care for the sheep.

block.text: Ia lari karena ia seorang upahan dan tidak memperhatikan domba-domba itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: I am the good shepherd. I know my own, and I'm known by my own;
even as the Father knows me, and I know the Father. I lay down my life for the sheep.

block.text: <<Akulah gembala yang baik dan Aku mengenal domba-domba-Ku dan domba-domba-Ku mengenal Aku
sama seperti Bapa mengenal Aku dan Aku mengenal Bapa, dan Aku memberikan nyawa-Ku bagi domba-domba-Ku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I have other sheep, which are not of this fold. I must bring them also, and they will hear my voice. They will become one flock with one shepherd.

block.text: Ada lagi pada-Ku domba-domba lain, yang bukan dari kandang ini; domba-domba itu harus Kutuntun juga dan mereka akan mendengarkan suara-Ku dan mereka akan menjadi satu kawanan dengan satu gembala.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore the Father loves me, because I lay down my life, that I may take it again.

block.text: Bapa mengasihi Aku, oleh karena Aku memberikan nyawa-Ku untuk menerimanya kembali.

ReferenceBlocks.text: No one takes it away from me, but I lay it down by myself. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it again. I received this commandment from my Father.”

block.text: Tidak seorangpun mengambilnya dari pada-Ku, melainkan Aku memberikannya menurut kehendak-Ku sendiri. Aku berkuasa memberikannya dan berkuasa mengambilnya kembali. Inilah tugas yang Kuterima dari Bapa-Ku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore a division arose again among the Jews because of these words.
Many of them said,

block.text: Maka timbullah pula pertentangan di antara orang-orang Yahudi karena perkataan itu. Banyak di antara mereka berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He has a demon, and is insane! Why do you listen to him?”

block.text: <<Ia kerasukan setan dan gila; mengapa kamu mendengarkan Dia?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others said,

block.text: Yang lain berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “These are not the sayings of one possessed by a demon. It isn't possible for a demon to open the eyes of the blind, is it?”

block.text: <<Itu bukan perkataan orang yang kerasukan setan;>> <<dapatkah setan memelekkan mata orang-orang buta?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: It was the Feast of the Dedication at Jerusalem.

block.text: Tidak lama kemudian tibalah hari raya Pentahbisan Bait Allah di Yerusalem; ketika itu musim dingin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It was winter, and Jesus was walking in the temple, in Solomon's porch.

block.text: Dan Yesus berjalan-jalan di Bait Allah, di serambi Salomo.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Jews therefore came around him and said to him,

block.text: Maka orang-orang Yahudi mengelilingi Dia dan berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How long will you hold us in suspense? If you are the Christ, tell us plainly.”

block.text: <<Berapa lama lagi Engkau membiarkan kami hidup dalam kebimbangan? Jikalau Engkau Mesias, katakanlah terus terang kepada kami.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Yesus menjawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I told you, and you don't believe. The works that I do in my Father's name, these testify about me.

block.text: <<Aku telah mengatakannya kepada kamu, tetapi kamu tidak percaya; pekerjaan-pekerjaan yang Kulakukan dalam nama Bapa-Ku, itulah yang memberikan kesaksian tentang Aku,

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you don't believe, because you are not of my sheep, as I told you.

block.text: tetapi kamu tidak percaya, karena kamu tidak termasuk domba-domba-Ku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me.

block.text: Domba-domba-Ku mendengarkan suara-Ku dan Aku mengenal mereka dan mereka mengikut Aku,

ReferenceBlocks.text: I give eternal life to them. They will never perish, and no one will snatch them out of my hand.

block.text: dan Aku memberikan hidup yang kekal kepada mereka dan mereka pasti tidak akan binasa sampai selama-lamanya dan seorangpun tidak akan merebut mereka dari tangan-Ku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: My Father, who has given them to me, is greater than all. No one is able to snatch them out of my Father's hand.
I and the Father are one.”

block.text: Bapa-Ku, yang memberikan mereka kepada-Ku, lebih besar dari pada siapapun, dan seorangpun tidak dapat merebut mereka dari tangan Bapa.
Aku dan Bapa adalah satu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore Jews took up stones again to stone him.
Jesus answered them,

block.text: Sekali lagi orang-orang Yahudi mengambil batu untuk melempari Yesus.
Kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have shown you many good works from my Father. For which of those works do you stone me?”

block.text: <<Banyak pekerjaan baik yang berasal dari Bapa-Ku yang Kuperlihatkan kepadamu; pekerjaan manakah di antaranya yang menyebabkan kamu mau melempari Aku?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Jews answered him,

block.text: Jawab orang-orang Yahudi itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We don't stone you for a good work, but for blasphemy: because you, being a man, make yourself God.”

block.text: <<Bukan karena suatu pekerjaan baik maka kami mau melempari Engkau, melainkan karena Engkau menghujat Allah dan karena Engkau, sekalipun hanya seorang manusia saja, menyamakan diri-Mu dengan Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Isn't it written in your law, ‘I said, you are gods?’

block.text: <<Bukankah ada tertulis dalam kitab Taurat kamu" kataku, Anda adalah allah? '

ReferenceBlocks.text: God called them gods to whom the word of God came (and the Scripture can't be broken).

block.text: Namun Allah memanggil mereka dewa kepada siapa firman Allah datang (dan Kitab Suci tidak dapat dibatalkan).

ReferenceBlocks.text: God has set me apart for Himself. He sent me into the world. Then how can you say that I am blaspheming because I said, ‘I am the Son of God’?

block.text: Allah telah menempatkan aku terpisah untuk sendiri. Dia mengutus Aku ke dunia. Lalu bagaimana Anda bisa mengatakan bahwa saya menghujat karena saya berkata, 'Akulah Anak Allah'?

ReferenceBlocks.text: If I don't do the works of my Father, don't believe me.

block.text: Jikalau Aku tidak melakukan pekerjaan-pekerjaan Bapa-Ku, janganlah percaya kepada-Ku,

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if I do them, though you don't believe me, believe the works; that you may know and believe that the Father is in me, and I in the Father.”

block.text: tetapi jikalau Aku melakukannya dan kamu tidak mau percaya kepada-Ku, percayalah akan pekerjaan-pekerjaan itu, supaya kamu boleh mengetahui dan mengerti, bahwa Bapa di dalam Aku dan Aku di dalam Bapa.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They sought again to seize him, and he went out of their hand.

block.text: Sekali lagi mereka mencoba menangkap Dia, tetapi Ia luput dari tangan mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went away again beyond the Jordan into the place where John was baptizing at first, and there he stayed.

block.text: Kemudian Yesus pergi lagi ke seberang Yordan, ke tempat Yohanes membaptis dahulu, lalu Ia tinggal di situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many came to him. They said,

block.text: Dan banyak orang datang kepada-Nya dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “John indeed did no sign, but everything that John said about this man is true.”

block.text: <<Yohanes memang tidak membuat satu tandapun, tetapi semua yang pernah dikatakan Yohanes tentang orang ini adalah benar.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many believed in him there.

block.text: Dan banyak orang di situ percaya kepada-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN CHP 11
Now a certain man was sick, Lazarus from Bethany, of the village of Mary and her sister, Martha.

block.text: Ada seorang yang sedang sakit, namanya Lazarus. Ia tinggal di Betania, kampung Maria dan adiknya Marta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It was that Mary who had anointed the Lord with ointment and wiped his feet with her hair. It was her brother Lazarus who was sick.

block.text: Maria ialah perempuan yang pernah meminyaki kaki Tuhan dengan minyak mur dan menyekanya dengan rambutnya. Dan Lazarus yang sakit itu adalah saudaranya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The sisters therefore sent to him, saying,

block.text: Kedua perempuan itu mengirim kabar kepada Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, behold, he for whom you have great affection is sick.”

block.text: <<Tuhan, dia yang Engkau kasihi, sakit.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Jesus heard it, he said,

block.text: Ketika Yesus mendengar kabar itu, Ia berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This sickness is not to death, but for the glory of God, that God's Son may be glorified by it.”

block.text: <<Penyakit itu tidak akan membawa kematian, tetapi akan menyatakan kemuliaan Allah, sebab oleh penyakit itu Anak Allah akan dimuliakan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Jesus loved Martha, and her sister, and Lazarus.

block.text: Yesus memang mengasihi Marta dan kakaknya dan Lazarus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When therefore he heard that he was sick, he stayed two days in the place where he was.

block.text: Namun setelah didengar-Nya, bahwa Lazarus sakit, Ia sengaja tinggal dua hari lagi di tempat, di mana Ia berada;

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then after this he said to the disciples,

block.text: tetapi sesudah itu Ia berkata kepada murid-murid-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let's go into Judea again.”

block.text: <<Mari kita kembali lagi ke Yudea.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciples told him,

block.text: Murid-murid itu berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi, the Jews were just trying to stone you, and are you going there again?”

block.text: <<Rabi, baru-baru ini orang-orang Yahudi mencoba melempari Engkau, masih maukah Engkau kembali ke sana?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Aren't there twelve hours of daylight? If a man walks in the day, he doesn't stumble, because he sees the light of this world.

block.text: <<Bukankah ada dua belas jam dalam satu hari? Siapa yang berjalan pada siang hari, kakinya tidak terantuk, karena ia melihat terang dunia ini.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if a man walks in the night, he stumbles, because the light isn't in him.”

block.text: Tetapi jikalau seorang berjalan pada malam hari, kakinya terantuk, karena terang tidak ada di dalam dirinya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said these things, and after that, he said to them,

block.text: Demikianlah perkataan-Nya, dan sesudah itu Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Our friend, Lazarus, has fallen asleep, but I am going so that I may awake him out of sleep.”

block.text: <<Lazarus, saudara kita, telah tertidur, tetapi Aku pergi ke sana untuk membangunkan dia dari tidurnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciples therefore said,

block.text: Maka kata murid-murid itu kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, if he has fallen asleep, he will recover.”

block.text: <<Tuhan, jikalau ia tertidur, ia akan sembuh.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Jesus had spoken of his death, but they thought that he spoke of taking rest in sleep.

block.text: Tetapi maksud Yesus ialah tertidur dalam arti mati, sedangkan sangka mereka Yesus berkata tentang tertidur dalam arti biasa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So Jesus said to them plainly then,

block.text: Karena itu Yesus berkata dengan terus terang:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lazarus is dead.
I am glad for your sakes that I was not there, so that you may believe. Nevertheless, let's go to him.”

block.text: <<Lazarus sudah mati;
tetapi syukurlah Aku tidak hadir pada waktu itu, sebab demikian lebih baik bagimu, supaya kamu dapat belajar percaya. Marilah kita pergi sekarang kepadanya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Thomas therefore, who is called Didymus, said to his fellow disciples,

block.text: Lalu Tomas, yang disebut Didimus, berkata kepada teman-temannya, yaitu murid-murid yang lain:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let's go also, that we may die with him.”

block.text: <<Marilah kita pergi juga untuk mati bersama-sama dengan Dia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when Jesus came, the people told him:

block.text: Maka ketika Yesus tiba,

block.characterId: person near Lazarus' grave who informed Jesus

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: person near Lazarus' grave who informed Jesus
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lazarus has been in the tomb for four days.”

block.text: didapati-Nya Lazarus telah empat hari berbaring di dalam kubur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Bethany was near Jerusalem, about fifteen stadia away.

block.text: Betania terletak dekat Yerusalem, kira-kira dua mil jauhnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many of the Jews had joined the women around Martha and Mary, to console them concerning their brother.

block.text: Di situ banyak orang Yahudi telah datang kepada Marta dan Maria untuk menghibur mereka berhubung dengan kematian saudaranya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then when Martha heard that Jesus was coming, she went and met him, but Mary stayed in the house.

block.text: Ketika Marta mendengar, bahwa Yesus datang, ia pergi mendapatkan-Nya. Tetapi Maria tinggal di rumah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore Martha said to Jesus,

block.text: Maka kata Marta kepada Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, if you would have been here, my brother wouldn't have died.

block.text: <<Tuhan, sekiranya Engkau ada di sini, saudaraku pasti tidak mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even now I know that God will give you whatever you ask of Him.”

block.text: Tetapi sekarangpun aku tahu, bahwa Allah akan memberikan kepada-Mu segala sesuatu yang Engkau minta kepada-Nya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to her,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepada Marta:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your brother will rise again.”

block.text: <<Saudaramu akan bangkit.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Martha said to him,

block.text: Kata Marta kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I know that he will rise again in the resurrection at the last day.”

block.text: <<Aku tahu bahwa ia akan bangkit pada waktu orang-orang bangkit pada akhir zaman.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to her,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am the resurrection and the life. He who believes in me will still live, even if he dies.

block.text: <<Akulah kebangkitan dan hidup; barangsiapa percaya kepada-Ku, ia akan hidup walaupun ia sudah mati,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever lives and believes in me will never die. Do you believe this?”

block.text: dan setiap orang yang hidup dan yang percaya kepada-Ku, tidak akan mati selama-lamanya. Percayakah engkau akan hal ini?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: She said to him,

block.text: Jawab Marta:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes, Lord. I have come to believe that you are the Christ, God's Son, he who comes into the world.”

block.text: <<Ya, Tuhan, aku percaya, bahwa Engkaulah Mesias, Anak Allah, Dia yang akan datang ke dalam dunia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When she had said this, she went away, and called Mary, her sister, secretly, saying,

block.text: Dan sesudah berkata demikian ia pergi memanggil saudaranya Maria dan berbisik kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Teacher is here, and is calling you.”

block.text: <<Guru ada di sana dan Ia memanggil engkau.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When she heard this, she arose quickly, and went to him.

block.text: Mendengar itu Maria segera bangkit lalu pergi mendapatkan Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Jesus had not yet come into the village, but was in the place where Martha met him.

block.text: Tetapi waktu itu Yesus belum sampai ke dalam kampung itu. Ia masih berada di tempat Marta menjumpai Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the Jews who were with her in the house, consoling her, when they saw Mary, that she rose up quickly and went out, followed her, supposing she was going to the tomb to mourn there.

block.text: Ketika orang-orang Yahudi yang bersama-sama dengan Maria di rumah itu untuk menghiburnya, melihat bahwa Maria segera bangkit dan pergi ke luar, mereka mengikutinya, karena mereka menyangka bahwa ia pergi ke kubur untuk meratap di situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore when Mary came to where Jesus was, and saw him, she fell down at his feet, saying to him,

block.text: Setibanya Maria di tempat Yesus berada dan melihat Dia, tersungkurlah ia di depan kaki-Nya dan berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, if you would have been here, my brother wouldn't have died.”

block.text: <<Tuhan, sekiranya Engkau ada di sini, saudaraku pasti tidak mati.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus therefore saw her weeping, and the Jews weeping who came with her, he groaned in the spirit, and was troubled,
and said,

block.text: Ketika Yesus melihat Maria menangis dan juga orang-orang Yahudi yang datang bersama-sama dia, maka masygullah hati-Nya. Ia sangat terharu dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where have you laid him?”

block.text: <<Di manakah dia kamu baringkan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him,

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, come and see.”

block.text: <<Tuhan, marilah dan lihatlah!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus wept.
The Jews therefore said,

block.text: Maka menangislah Yesus.
Kata orang-orang Yahudi:

block.characterId: Jews who had been with Mary and Martha

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Jews who had been with Mary and Martha
ReferenceBlocks.text: “See how much affection he had for him!”

block.text: <<Lihatlah, betapa kasih-Nya kepadanya!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of them said,

block.text: Tetapi beberapa orang di antaranya berkata:

block.characterId: Jews who had been with Mary and Martha, some

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Jews who had been with Mary and Martha, some
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Couldn't this man, who opened the eyes of him who was blind, have also kept this man from dying?”

block.text: <<Ia yang memelekkan mata orang buta, tidak sanggupkah Ia bertindak, sehingga orang ini tidak mati?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus therefore, again groaning in himself, came to the tomb. Now it was a cave, and a stone lay against it.
Jesus said,

block.text: Maka masygullah pula hati Yesus, lalu Ia pergi ke kubur itu. Kubur itu adalah sebuah gua yang ditutup dengan batu.
Kata Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Take away the stone.”

block.text: <<Angkat batu itu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Martha, the sister of him who was dead, said to him,

block.text: Marta, saudara orang yang meninggal itu, berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, by this time there is a stench, for he has been dead four days.”

block.text: <<Tuhan, ia sudah berbau, sebab sudah empat hari ia mati.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to her,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Didn't I tell you that if you believed, you would see God's glory?”

block.text: <<Bukankah sudah Kukatakan kepadamu: Jikalau engkau percaya engkau akan melihat kemuliaan Allah?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So they took away the stone from the place where the dead man was lying. Jesus lifted up his eyes, and said,

block.text: Maka mereka mengangkat batu itu. Lalu Yesus menengadah ke atas dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Father, I thank you that you have heard me.

block.text: <<Bapa, Aku mengucap syukur kepada-Mu, karena Engkau telah mendengarkan Aku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I know that you always hear me, but because of the multitude that stands around I said this, that they may believe that you sent me.”

block.text: Aku tahu, bahwa Engkau selalu mendengarkan Aku, tetapi oleh karena orang banyak yang berdiri di sini mengelilingi Aku, Aku mengatakannya, supaya mereka percaya, bahwa Engkaulah yang telah mengutus Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said this, he cried with a loud voice,

block.text: Dan sesudah berkata demikian, berserulah Ia dengan suara keras:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lazarus, come out!”

block.text: <<Lazarus, marilah ke luar!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who was dead came out, bound hand and foot with wrappings, and his face was wrapped around with a cloth. Jesus said to them,

block.text: Orang yang telah mati itu datang ke luar, kaki dan tangannya masih terikat dengan kain kapan dan mukanya tertutup dengan kain peluh. Kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Free him, and let him go.”

block.text: <<Bukalah kain-kain itu dan biarkan ia pergi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore many of the Jews, who came to Mary and saw what Jesus did, believed in him.

block.text: Banyak di antara orang-orang Yahudi yang datang melawat Maria dan yang menyaksikan sendiri apa yang telah dibuat Yesus, percaya kepada-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But some of them went away to the Pharisees, and told them the things which Jesus had done.

block.text: Tetapi ada yang pergi kepada orang-orang Farisi dan menceriterakan kepada mereka, apa yang telah dibuat Yesus itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The chief priests therefore and the Pharisees gathered a council, and said,

block.text: Lalu imam-imam kepala dan orang-orang Farisi memanggil Mahkamah Agama untuk berkumpul dan mereka berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What are we going to do? This man does many signs.
If we leave him alone like this, everyone will believe in him, and the Romans will come and take away both our place and our nation.”

block.text: <<Apakah yang harus kita buat? Sebab orang itu membuat banyak mujizat.>>
<<Apabila kita biarkan Dia, maka semua orang akan percaya kepada-Nya dan orang-orang Roma akan datang dan akan merampas tempat suci kita serta bangsa kita.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But a certain one of them, Caiaphas, being high priest that year, said to them,

block.text: Tetapi seorang di antara mereka, yaitu Kayafas, Imam Besar pada tahun itu, berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You know nothing at all,
nor do you consider that it is advantageous for us that one man should die for the people, and that the whole nation not perish.”

block.text: <<Kamu tidak tahu apa-apa,
dan kamu tidak insaf, bahwa lebih berguna bagimu, jika satu orang mati untuk bangsa kita dari pada seluruh bangsa kita ini binasa.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now he didn't say this of himself, but being high priest that year, he prophesied that Jesus would die for the nation,

block.text: Hal itu dikatakannya bukan dari dirinya sendiri, tetapi sebagai Imam Besar pada tahun itu ia bernubuat, bahwa Yesus akan mati untuk bangsa itu,

ReferenceBlocks.text: and not for the nation only, but that he might also gather together into one the children of God who are scattered abroad.

block.text: dan bukan untuk bangsa itu saja, tetapi juga untuk mengumpulkan dan mempersatukan anak-anak Allah yang tercerai-berai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So from that day forward they took counsel that they might put him to death.

block.text: Mulai dari hari itu mereka sepakat untuk membunuh Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus therefore walked no more openly among the Jews, but departed from there into the country near the wilderness, to a city called Ephraim. He stayed there with his disciples.

block.text: Karena itu Yesus tidak tampil lagi di muka umum di antara orang-orang Yahudi, Ia berangkat dari situ ke daerah dekat padang gurun, ke sebuah kota yang bernama Efraim, dan di situ Ia tinggal bersama-sama murid-murid-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now the Passover of the Jews was at hand. Many went up from the country to Jerusalem before the Passover, to purify themselves.

block.text: Pada waktu itu hari raya Paskah orang Yahudi sudah dekat dan banyak orang dari negeri itu berangkat ke Yerusalem untuk menyucikan diri sebelum Paskah itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they sought for Jesus and spoke one with another, as they stood in the temple,

block.text: Mereka mencari Yesus dan sambil berdiri di dalam Bait Allah, mereka berkata seorang kepada yang lain:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do you think--that he isn't coming to the feast at all?”

block.text: <<Bagaimana pendapatmu? Akan datang jugakah Ia ke pesta?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now the chief priests and the Pharisees had commanded that if anyone knew where he was, he should report it, that they might seize him.

block.text: Sementara itu imam-imam kepala dan orang-orang Farisi telah memberikan perintah supaya setiap orang yang tahu di mana Dia berada memberitahukannya, agar mereka dapat menangkap Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN CHP 12
Then six days before the Passover, Jesus came to Bethany, where Lazarus was, who had been dead, whom he raised from the dead.

block.text: Enam hari sebelum Paskah Yesus datang ke Betania, tempat tinggal Lazarus yang dibangkitkan Yesus dari antara orang mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So they made him a supper there. Martha served, but Lazarus was one of those who sat at the table with him.

block.text: Di situ diadakan perjamuan untuk Dia dan Marta melayani, sedang salah seorang yang turut makan dengan Yesus adalah Lazarus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Mary, therefore, took a pound of ointment of pure nard, very precious, and anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped his feet with her hair. The house was filled with the fragrance of the ointment.

block.text: Maka Maria mengambil setengah kati minyak narwastu murni yang mahal harganya, lalu meminyaki kaki Yesus dan menyekanya dengan rambutnya; dan bau minyak semerbak di seluruh rumah itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Judas Iscariot, Simon's son, one of his disciples, who would betray him, said,

block.text: Tetapi Yudas Iskariot, seorang dari murid-murid Yesus, yang akan segera menyerahkan Dia, berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why wasn't this ointment sold for three hundred denarii, and given to the poor?”

block.text: <<Mengapa minyak narwastu ini tidak dijual tiga ratus dinar dan uangnya diberikan kepada orang-orang miskin?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now he said this, not because he cared for the poor, but because he was a thief, and having the money box, used to steal what was put into it.
But Jesus said,

block.text: Hal itu dikatakannya bukan karena ia memperhatikan nasib orang-orang miskin, melainkan karena ia adalah seorang pencuri; ia sering mengambil uang yang disimpan dalam kas yang dipegangnya.
Maka kata Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Leave her alone. She has kept this for the day of my burial.

block.text: <<Biarkanlah dia melakukan hal ini mengingat hari penguburan-Ku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For you always have the poor with you, but you don't always have me.”

block.text: Karena orang-orang miskin selalu ada pada kamu, tetapi Aku tidak akan selalu ada pada kamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: A large crowd therefore of the Jews learned that he was there, and they came, not for Jesus’ sake only, but that they might see Lazarus also, whom he had raised from the dead.

block.text: Sejumlah besar orang Yahudi mendengar, bahwa Yesus ada di sana dan mereka datang bukan hanya karena Yesus, melainkan juga untuk melihat Lazarus, yang telah dibangkitkan-Nya dari antara orang mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the chief priests conspired to put Lazarus to death also.

block.text: Lalu imam-imam kepala bermupakat untuk membunuh Lazarus juga,

ReferenceBlocks.text: because on account of Lazarus many of the Jews went away and believed in Jesus.

block.text: sebab karena dia banyak orang Yahudi meninggalkan mereka dan percaya kepada Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the next day a great multitude had come to the feast. When they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,
they took the branches of the palm trees, and went out to meet him, and cried out,

block.text: Keesokan harinya ketika orang banyak yang datang merayakan pesta mendengar, bahwa Yesus sedang di tengah jalan menuju Yerusalem,
mereka mengambil daun-daun palem, dan pergi menyongsong Dia sambil berseru-seru:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Hosanna! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord, the King of Israel!”

block.text: <<Hosana! Diberkatilah Dia yang datang dalam nama Tuhan, Raja Israel!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, having found a young donkey, sat on it. As it is written,

block.text: Yesus menemukan seekor keledai muda lalu Ia naik ke atasnya, seperti ada tertulis:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't be afraid, daughter of Zion. Behold, your King comes, sitting on a donkey's colt.”

block.text: <<Jangan takut, hai puteri Sion, lihatlah, Rajamu datang, duduk di atas seekor anak keledai.>>
