ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore when Jesus saw his mother, and the disciple whom he loved standing there, he said to his mother,

block.text: Ketika Yesus melihat ibu-Nya dan murid yang dikasihi-Nya di sampingnya, berkatalah Ia kepada ibu-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woman, behold your son!”

block.text: <<Ibu, inilah, anakmu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said to the disciple,

block.text: Kemudian kata-Nya kepada murid-murid-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, your mother!”

block.text: <<Inilah ibumu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: From that hour, the disciple took her to his own home.

block.text: Dan sejak saat itu murid itu menerima dia di dalam rumahnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After this, Jesus, seeing that all things were now finished, that the Scripture might be fulfilled, said,

block.text: Sesudah itu, karena Yesus tahu, bahwa segala sesuatu telah selesai, berkatalah Ia—supaya genaplah yang ada tertulis dalam Kitab Suci—:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am thirsty.”

block.text: <<Aku haus!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now a vessel full of vinegar was set there; so they put a sponge full of the vinegar on hyssop, and held it at his mouth.

block.text: Di situ ada suatu bekas penuh anggur asam. Maka mereka mencucukkan bunga karang, yang telah dicelupkan dalam anggur asam, pada sebatang hisop lalu mengunjukkannya ke mulut Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said,

block.text: Sesudah Yesus meminum anggur asam itu, berkatalah Ia:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is finished.”

block.text: <<Sudah selesai.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He bowed his head, and gave up his spirit.

block.text: Lalu Ia menundukkan kepala-Nya dan menyerahkan nyawa-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore the Jews, because it was the Preparation Day, so that the bodies wouldn't remain on the cross on the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was a special one), asked of Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.

block.text: Karena hari itu hari persiapan dan supaya pada hari Sabat mayat-mayat itu tidak tinggal tergantung pada kayu salib—sebab Sabat itu adalah hari yang besar—maka datanglah orang-orang Yahudi kepada Pilatus dan meminta kepadanya supaya kaki orang-orang itu dipatahkan dan mayat-mayatnya diturunkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore the soldiers came, and broke the legs of the first, and of the other who was crucified with him;

block.text: Maka datanglah prajurit-prajurit lalu mematahkan kaki orang yang pertama dan kaki orang yang lain yang disalibkan bersama-sama dengan Yesus;

ReferenceBlocks.text: but when they came to Jesus, and saw that he was already dead, they didn't break his legs.

block.text: tetapi ketika mereka sampai kepada Yesus dan melihat bahwa Ia telah mati, mereka tidak mematahkan kaki-Nya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: However one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear, and immediately blood and water came out.

block.text: tetapi seorang dari antara prajurit itu menikam lambung-Nya dengan tombak, dan segera mengalir keluar darah dan air.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who has seen has testified, and his testimony is true. He knows that he tells the truth, that you may believe.

block.text: Dan orang yang melihat hal itu sendiri yang memberikan kesaksian ini dan kesaksiannya benar, dan ia tahu, bahwa ia mengatakan kebenaran, supaya kamu juga percaya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For these things happened, that the Scripture might be fulfilled,

block.text: Sebab hal itu terjadi, supaya genaplah yang tertulis dalam Kitab Suci:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A bone of him will not be broken.”

block.text: <<Tidak ada tulang-Nya yang akan dipatahkan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again another Scripture says,

block.text: Dan ada pula nas yang mengatakan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They will look on him whom they pierced.”

block.text: <<Mereka akan memandang kepada Dia yang telah mereka tikam.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: After these things, Joseph of Arimathaea, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, asked Pilate:

block.text: Sesudah itu Yusuf dari Arimatea—ia murid Yesus, tetapi sembunyi-sembunyi karena takut kepada orang-orang Yahudi—meminta kepada Pilatus,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “May I take Jesus’ body for burial?”

block.text: supaya ia diperbolehkan menurunkan mayat Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate gave him permission. He came therefore and took away his body.

block.text: Dan Pilatus meluluskan permintaannya itu. Lalu datanglah ia dan menurunkan mayat itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nicodemus, who at first came to Jesus by night, also came bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about a hundred Roman pounds.

block.text: Juga Nikodemus datang ke situ. Dialah yang mula-mula datang waktu malam kepada Yesus. Ia membawa campuran minyak mur dengan minyak gaharu, kira-kira lima puluh kati beratnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So they took Jesus’ body, and bound it in linen cloths with the spices, as the custom of the Jews is to bury.

block.text: Mereka mengambil mayat Yesus, mengapaninya dengan kain lenan dan membubuhinya dengan rempah-rempah menurut adat orang Yahudi bila menguburkan mayat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now in the place where he was crucified there was a garden. In the garden was a new tomb in which no man had ever yet been laid.

block.text: Dekat tempat di mana Yesus disalibkan ada suatu taman dan dalam taman itu ada suatu kubur baru yang di dalamnya belum pernah dimakamkan seseorang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then because of the Jews’ Preparation Day (for the tomb was near at hand) they laid Jesus there.

block.text: Karena hari itu hari persiapan orang Yahudi, sedang kubur itu tidak jauh letaknya, maka mereka meletakkan mayat Yesus ke situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN CHP 20
Now on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene went early, while it was still dark, to the tomb, and saw the stone taken away from the tomb.

block.text: Pada hari pertama minggu itu, pagi-pagi benar ketika hari masih gelap, pergilah Maria Magdalena ke kubur itu dan ia melihat bahwa batu telah diambil dari kubur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore she ran and came to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple whom Jesus loved, and said to them,

block.text: Ia berlari-lari mendapatkan Simon Petrus dan murid yang lain yang dikasihi Yesus, dan berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They have taken away the Lord out of the tomb, and we don't know where they have laid him!”

block.text: <<Tuhan telah diambil orang dari kuburnya dan kami tidak tahu di mana Ia diletakkan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore Peter and the other disciple went out, and they went toward the tomb.

block.text: Maka berangkatlah Petrus dan murid yang lain itu ke kubur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They both ran together. The other disciple outran Peter, and came to the tomb first.

block.text: Keduanya berlari bersama-sama, tetapi murid yang lain itu berlari lebih cepat dari pada Petrus sehingga lebih dahulu sampai di kubur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Stooping and looking in, he saw the linen cloths lying, yet he didn't enter in.

block.text: Ia menjenguk ke dalam, dan melihat kain kapan terletak di tanah; akan tetapi ia tidak masuk ke dalam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Simon Peter came, following him, and entered into the tomb. He saw the linen cloths lying,
and the cloth that had been on his head, not lying with the linen cloths, but rolled up in a place by itself.

block.text: Maka datanglah Simon Petrus juga menyusul dia dan masuk ke dalam kubur itu. Ia melihat kain kapan terletak di tanah,
sedang kain peluh yang tadinya ada di kepala Yesus tidak terletak dekat kain kapan itu, tetapi agak di samping di tempat yang lain dan sudah tergulung.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So then the other disciple who came first to the tomb also entered in, and he saw and believed.

block.text: Maka masuklah juga murid yang lain, yang lebih dahulu sampai di kubur itu dan ia melihatnya dan percaya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For as yet they didn't know the Scripture, that he must rise from the dead.

block.text: Sebab selama itu mereka belum mengerti isi Kitab Suci yang mengatakan, bahwa Ia harus bangkit dari antara orang mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So the disciples went away again to their own homes.

block.text: Lalu pulanglah kedua murid itu ke rumah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Mary was standing outside at the tomb weeping. So, as she wept, she stooped and looked into the tomb,

block.text: Tetapi Maria berdiri dekat kubur itu dan menangis. Sambil menangis ia menjenguk ke dalam kubur itu,

ReferenceBlocks.text: and she saw two angels in white sitting, one at the head, and one at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain.
They told her,

block.text: dan tampaklah olehnya dua orang malaikat berpakaian putih, yang seorang duduk di sebelah kepala dan yang lain di sebelah kaki di tempat mayat Yesus terbaring.
Kata malaikat-malaikat itu kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woman, why are you weeping?”

block.text: <<Ibu, mengapa engkau menangis?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: She said to them,

block.text: Jawab Maria kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Because they have taken away my Lord, and I don't know where they have laid him.”

block.text: <<Tuhanku telah diambil orang dan aku tidak tahu di mana Ia diletakkan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When she had said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing, and didn't know that it was Jesus.
Jesus said to her,

block.text: Sesudah berkata demikian ia menoleh ke belakang dan melihat Yesus berdiri di situ, tetapi ia tidak tahu, bahwa itu adalah Yesus.
Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woman, why are you weeping? Who are you looking for?”

block.text: <<Ibu, mengapa engkau menangis? Siapakah yang engkau cari?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: She, supposing him to be the gardener, said to him,

block.text: Maria menyangka orang itu adalah penunggu taman, lalu berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have laid him, and I will take him away.”

block.text: <<Tuan, jikalau tuan yang mengambil Dia, katakanlah kepadaku, di mana tuan meletakkan Dia, supaya aku dapat mengambil-Nya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to her,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Mary.”

block.text: <<Maria!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: She turned and said to him,

block.text: Maria berpaling dan berkata kepada-Nya dalam bahasa Ibrani:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabboni!”

block.text: <<Rabuni!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: which is to say, “Teacher!”
Jesus said to her,

block.text: artinya Guru.
Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't hold me, for I haven't yet ascended to my Father; but go to my brothers, and tell them, ‘I am ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.’”

block.text: <<Janganlah engkau memegang Aku, sebab Aku belum pergi kepada Bapa, tetapi pergilah kepada saudara-saudara-Ku dan katakanlah kepada mereka, <bahwa sekarang Aku akan pergi kepada Bapa-Ku dan Bapamu, kepada Allah-Ku dan Allahmu.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples:

block.text: Maria Magdalena pergi dan berkata kepada murid-murid:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have seen the Lord!”,

block.text: <<Aku telah melihat Tuhan!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: and she told them what he had said to her.

block.text: dan juga bahwa Dia yang mengatakan hal-hal itu kepadanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When therefore it was evening, on that day, the first day of the week, and when the doors were locked where the disciples were assembled, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the midst, and said to them,

block.text: Ketika hari sudah malam pada hari pertama minggu itu berkumpullah murid-murid Yesus di suatu tempat dengan pintu-pintu yang terkunci karena mereka takut kepada orang-orang Yahudi. Pada waktu itu datanglah Yesus dan berdiri di tengah-tengah mereka dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Peace be to you.”

block.text: <<Damai sejahtera bagi kamu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his side. The disciples therefore were glad when they saw the Lord.
Jesus therefore said to them again,

block.text: Dan sesudah berkata demikian, Ia menunjukkan tangan-Nya dan lambung-Nya kepada mereka. Murid-murid itu bersukacita ketika mereka melihat Tuhan.
Maka kata Yesus sekali lagi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Peace be to you. As the Father has sent me, even so I send you.”

block.text: <<Damai sejahtera bagi kamu! Sama seperti Bapa mengutus Aku, demikian juga sekarang Aku mengutus kamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said this, he breathed on them, and said to them,

block.text: Dan sesudah berkata demikian, Ia mengembusi mereka dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Receive the Holy Spirit!
If you forgive anyone's sins, they have been forgiven them. If you retain anyone's sins, they have been retained.”

block.text: <<Terimalah Roh Kudus.
Jikalau kamu mengampuni dosa orang, dosanya diampuni, dan jikalau kamu menyatakan dosa orang tetap ada, dosanya tetap ada.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, wasn't with them when Jesus came.

block.text: Tetapi Tomas, seorang dari kedua belas murid itu, yang disebut Didimus, tidak ada bersama-sama mereka, ketika Yesus datang ke situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The other disciples therefore said to him,

block.text: Maka kata murid-murid yang lain itu kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We have seen the Lord!”

block.text: <<Kami telah melihat Tuhan!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said to them,

block.text: Tetapi Tomas berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Unless I see in his hands the print of the nails, and put my hand into his side, I will not believe.”

block.text: <<Sebelum aku melihat bekas paku pada tangan-Nya dan sebelum aku mencucukkan jariku ke dalam bekas paku itu dan mencucukkan tanganku ke dalam lambung-Nya, sekali-kali aku tidak akan percaya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: After eight days again his disciples were inside, and Thomas was with them. Jesus came, the doors being locked, and stood in the midst, and said,

block.text: Delapan hari kemudian murid-murid Yesus berada kembali dalam rumah itu dan Tomas bersama-sama dengan mereka. Sementara pintu-pintu terkunci, Yesus datang dan Ia berdiri di tengah-tengah mereka dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Peace be to you.”

block.text: <<Damai sejahtera bagi kamu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said to Thomas,

block.text: Kemudian Ia berkata kepada Tomas:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Reach here your finger, and see my hands. Reach here your hand, and put it into my side. Don't be unbelieving, but believing.”

block.text: <<Taruhlah jarimu di sini dan lihatlah tangan-Ku, ulurkanlah tanganmu dan cucukkan ke dalam lambung-Ku dan jangan engkau tidak percaya lagi, melainkan percayalah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Thomas answered him,

block.text: Tomas menjawab Dia:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My Lord and my God!”

block.text: <<Ya Tuhanku dan Allahku!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Because you have seen me, you have believed. Blessed are those who have not seen, and have believed.”

block.text: <<Karena engkau telah melihat Aku, maka engkau percaya. Berbahagialah mereka yang tidak melihat, namun percaya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore Jesus did many other signs in the presence of his disciples, which are not written in this book;

block.text: Memang masih banyak tanda lain yang dibuat Yesus di depan mata murid-murid-Nya, yang tidak tercatat dalam kitab ini,

ReferenceBlocks.text: but these are written, that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that believing you may have life in his name.

block.text: tetapi semua yang tercantum di sini telah dicatat, supaya kamu percaya, bahwa Yesuslah Mesias, Anak Allah, dan supaya kamu oleh imanmu memperoleh hidup dalam nama-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN CHP 21
After these things, Jesus revealed himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias. He revealed himself this way.

block.text: Kemudian Yesus menampakkan diri lagi kepada murid-murid-Nya di pantai danau Tiberias dan Ia menampakkan diri sebagai berikut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon Peter, Thomas called Didymus, Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, and the sons of Zebedee, and two others of his disciples were together.
Simon Peter said to them,

block.text: Di pantai itu berkumpul Simon Petrus, Tomas yang disebut Didimus, Natanael dari Kana yang di Galilea, anak-anak Zebedeus dan dua orang murid-Nya yang lain.
Kata Simon Petrus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I'm going fishing.”

block.text: <<Aku pergi menangkap ikan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him,

block.text: Kata mereka kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We are also coming with you.”

block.text: <<Kami pergi juga dengan engkau.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They immediately went out, and entered into the boat. That night, they caught nothing.

block.text: Mereka berangkat lalu naik ke perahu, tetapi malam itu mereka tidak menangkap apa-apa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when day had already come, Jesus stood on the beach, yet the disciples didn't know that it was Jesus.
Jesus therefore said to them,

block.text: Ketika hari mulai siang, Yesus berdiri di pantai; akan tetapi murid-murid itu tidak tahu, bahwa itu adalah Yesus.
Kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Children, have you anything to eat?”

block.text: <<Hai anak-anak, adakah kamu mempunyai lauk-pauk?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered him,

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “No.”

block.text: <<Tidak ada.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Maka kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Cast the net on the right side of the boat, and you will find some.”

block.text: <<Tebarkanlah jalamu di sebelah kanan perahu, maka akan kamu peroleh.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They cast it therefore, and now they weren't able to draw it in for the multitude of fish.

block.text: Lalu mereka menebarkannya dan mereka tidak dapat menariknya lagi karena banyaknya ikan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciple therefore whom Jesus loved said to Peter,

block.text: Maka murid yang dikasihi Yesus itu berkata kepada Petrus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It's the Lord!”

block.text: <<Itu Tuhan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he wrapped his coat around him (for he was naked), and threw himself into the sea.

block.text: Ketika Petrus mendengar, bahwa itu adalah Tuhan, maka ia mengenakan pakaiannya, sebab ia tidak berpakaian, lalu terjun ke dalam danau.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the other disciples came in the little boat (for they were not far from the land, but about two hundred cubits away), dragging the net full of fish.

block.text: Murid-murid yang lain datang dengan perahu karena mereka tidak jauh dari darat, hanya kira-kira dua ratus hasta saja dan mereka menghela jala yang penuh ikan itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when they got out on the land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid on it, and bread.
Jesus said to them,

block.text: Ketika mereka tiba di darat, mereka melihat api arang dan di atasnya ikan dan roti.
Kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Bring some of the fish which you have just caught.”

block.text: <<Bawalah beberapa ikan, yang baru kamu tangkap itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon Peter went up, and drew the net to land, full of great fish, one hundred fifty-three; and even though there were so many, the net wasn't torn.
Jesus said to them,

block.text: Simon Petrus naik ke perahu lalu menghela jala itu ke darat, penuh ikan-ikan besar: seratus lima puluh tiga ekor banyaknya, dan sungguhpun sebanyak itu, jala itu tidak koyak.
Kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come and eat breakfast.”

block.text: <<Marilah dan sarapanlah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: None of the disciples dared inquire of him, “Who are you?” knowing that it was the Lord.

block.text: Tidak ada di antara murid-murid itu yang berani bertanya kepada-Nya: <<Siapakah Engkau?>> Sebab mereka tahu, bahwa Ia adalah Tuhan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Jesus came and took the bread, gave it to them, and the fish likewise.

block.text: Yesus maju ke depan, mengambil roti dan memberikannya kepada mereka, demikian juga ikan itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is now the third time that Jesus was revealed to his disciples, after he had risen from the dead.

block.text: Itulah ketiga kalinya Yesus menampakkan diri kepada murid-murid-Nya sesudah Ia bangkit dari antara orang mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when they had eaten their breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter,

block.text: Sesudah sarapan Yesus berkata kepada Simon Petrus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love me more than these?”

block.text: <<Simon, anak Yohanes, apakah engkau mengasihi Aku lebih dari pada mereka ini?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Jawab Petrus kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes, Lord; you know that I love you.”

block.text: <<Benar Tuhan, Engkau tahu, bahwa aku mengasihi Engkau.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Feed my lambs.”

block.text: <<Gembalakanlah domba-domba-Ku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him again a second time,

block.text: Kata Yesus pula kepadanya untuk kedua kalinya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love me?”

block.text: <<Simon, anak Yohanes, apakah engkau mengasihi Aku?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Jawab Petrus kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes, Lord; you know that I love you.”

block.text: <<Benar Tuhan, Engkau tahu, bahwa aku mengasihi Engkau.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tend my sheep.”

block.text: <<Gembalakanlah domba-domba-Ku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him the third time,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepadanya untuk ketiga kalinya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Simon, son of Jonah, do you have affection for me?”

block.text: <<Simon, anak Yohanes, apakah engkau mengasihi Aku?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter was grieved because he asked him the third time, “Do you love me?” He said to him,

block.text: Maka sedih hati Petrus karena Yesus berkata untuk ketiga kalinya: <<Apakah engkau mengasihi Aku?>> Dan ia berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, you know everything. You know that I love you!”

block.text: <<Tuhan, Engkau tahu segala sesuatu, Engkau tahu, bahwa aku mengasihi Engkau.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Feed my sheep.
Most certainly I tell you, when you were young, you dressed yourself, and walked where you wanted to.

block.text: <<Gembalakanlah domba-domba-Ku.
Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya ketika engkau masih muda engkau mengikat pinggangmu sendiri dan engkau berjalan ke mana saja kaukehendaki,

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another will dress you, and carry you where you don't want to go.”

block.text: tetapi jika engkau sudah menjadi tua, engkau akan mengulurkan tanganmu dan orang lain akan mengikat engkau dan membawa engkau ke tempat yang tidak kaukehendaki.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now he said this, signifying by what kind of death he would glorify God. When he had said this, he said to him,

block.text: Dan hal ini dikatakan-Nya untuk menyatakan bagaimana Petrus akan mati dan memuliakan Allah. Sesudah mengatakan demikian Ia berkata kepada Petrus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Follow me.”

block.text: <<Ikutlah Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Peter, turning around, saw a disciple following. This was the disciple whom Jesus sincerely loved, the one who had also leaned on Jesus’ breast at the supper and asked, “Lord, who is going to betray You?”

block.text: Ketika Petrus berpaling, ia melihat bahwa murid yang dikasihi Yesus sedang mengikuti mereka, yaitu murid yang pada waktu mereka sedang makan bersama duduk dekat Yesus dan yang berkata: <<Tuhan, siapakah dia yang akan menyerahkan Engkau?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter seeing him, said to Jesus,

block.text: Ketika Petrus melihat murid itu, ia berkata kepada Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, what about this man?”

block.text: <<Tuhan, apakah yang akan terjadi dengan dia ini?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If I desire that he stay until I come, what is that to you? You follow me.”

block.text: <<Jikalau Aku menghendaki, supaya ia tinggal hidup sampai Aku datang, itu bukan urusanmu. Tetapi engkau: ikutlah Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: This saying therefore went out among the brothers, that this disciple wouldn't die. Yet Jesus didn't say to him that he wouldn't die, but, “If I desire that he stay until I come, what is that to you?”

block.text: Maka tersebarlah kabar di antara saudara-saudara itu, bahwa murid itu tidak akan mati. Tetapi Yesus tidak mengatakan kepada Petrus, bahwa murid itu tidak akan mati, melainkan: <<Jikalau Aku menghendaki supaya ia tinggal hidup sampai Aku datang, itu bukan urusanmu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is the disciple who testifies about these things, and wrote these things. We know that his witness is true.

block.text: Dialah murid, yang memberi kesaksian tentang semuanya ini dan yang telah menuliskannya dan kita tahu, bahwa kesaksiannya itu benar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There are also many other things which Jesus did, which if they would all be written, I suppose that even the world itself wouldn't have room for the books that would be written.

block.text: Masih banyak hal-hal lain lagi yang diperbuat oleh Yesus, tetapi jikalau semuanya itu harus dituliskan satu per satu, maka agaknya dunia ini tidak dapat memuat semua kitab yang harus ditulis itu.
